Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr: hope it works- fun car stuff

yknow I always thought that would be a great fundraising event. . .

dragg races. . .

open to everyone, the attractive and alluring, but sometimes undetectable
tall asian types. . . the tough n rugged yet suprisingly elegant hairy biker
types. . . even newbies and curious types.

they could come out in their best cocktail dresses, nails done (if they're
into that), make-up n hair. . .a minimum of a 2.5-3" heel would be required.
. .

set em up in their own lanes. . .fire the pistol. . .

maybe some obstacles reminicent of Double Dare (if you remember that show).
. .like having to find a key to their handcuffs (put on @ point #2) in a
kiddie pool of ice cream and jello. . . .then one of those greased pole
crossings like they used to have back when I'd catch my dad watching playboy
games, years ago. . .a bigg slide at the end. . . maybe some wrestling would
ensue. . .

they have to keep their heels on at all times. . .the rest of the clothes
would just have to be on them at the beginning.

there could be sponsors for each. . .all the money would go to charity, and
people who sponsored the winner would get lil dragg queen trophies saying
like "My Queen was Queen of the Hill at the Dragg Racing for "blah blah
charity" Day Competition".
The other people could get a lil plaque saying like. . . well something
funny. . like about support or gay sex or something colorful like that. . .

I think it'd be a hit.
I'd participate myself but I'm kinda outta shape at the moment from not
partying enuf, and working too much (sortof).

it'd be fun to roam the pits at THAT race. . .

hehe, yeah dirty thoughts. . .it's ok. ..

: )

aK

>From: "aK" <aK@hard-grooves.com>
>To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
>Subject: [sfraves] nrr: hope it works- fun car stuff
>Date: Sat, 31 Jan 2004 23:17:59 -0800
>
>hehe
>
>so for the longest time now I've been dealing with a 99 civic that blew 
>it's engine and a 91 chevy puckup that had a tranny that died 2x. . . .
>
>Funny thing, my truck sat around for like 2 yrs, and when I replaced the 
>trans there were all these other lil issues I had to deal with. I had it 
>rewired to tow a car trailer (which I aquired), then the lights all stopped 
>working. I finally replaced all the parts to get the lights working and 
>even installed my stereo again. Then it died. I used to romp around the lil 
>foo foo hood here and people knew me as the guy you could hear coming from 
>a few blocks away. 12-14 spkrs, 4 10's, 1 6x9's, 2 6", 2 1", and these lil 
>plate speakers powered by the sickest phoeniz gold amps I've ever seen. 
>about 2000W total. . .now it's only about 12-1400. . .
>
>my civic tho, damn I can't wait to drive it.
>It's a d16y8 sohc vtec 1.6L motor. It "was" stock and is sort of stock at 
>the moment.
>Since I started shopping ebay for parts to fix it (which btw is the way to 
>go to save money). I've rebuilt practically the entire car. Heres a lil 
>list of what I've done (i dig talking car stuff to people).
>
>btw, san leandro honda has a cool website with all the part breakdown 
>schematics that you can order from and print out for help if you can't 
>figure out where what hose or whatever goes where.
>btw#2- If you're looking for car parts, one of the funnest places to go to 
>is the row of junkyard car lots on Depot Rd. In Hayward. A lil while ago 
>they seperated the lots and theres 2 import lots with mostly honda/acura, 
>one with mostly vw/volvo, etc. . . and a couple others. It's fun to go 
>scavenger hunting for car parts and then haggling with the guy to lower the 
>prices. More than likely I'll prolly just buy another d16 or b16 motor 
>(they run from like $300-500). And on EBay, things like MAP sensors and 
>Knock sensors sell like crazy. . .so if one happens to fall in your shoe or 
>something, you shouldn't toss it in the garbage.
>
>Motor mods-
>   a.. Motor was completely rebuilt. JDM (japanese design manufacturing) 
>pistons n rods (which are domed, not flat, and raise compression a couple 
>points). all new rings, etc had to be changed.
>   b.. Brand new crankshaft (after I had the other one reconditioned like 
>3x). I've gone thru 4 sets of motor bearings (which aren't really bearings) 
>that didn't fit and every time I torqued things down the motor wouldn't 
>turn over whatsoever. . .till the last time when I took the numbers off the 
>rods n crank and got bearings sized for those specifically.
>   c.. I have 3 or 4 stock cams, which I need for smog. One broke apart at 
>the gear end, one broke apart at the distributor end when I put the dist. 
>on 180degrees off.
>   d.. A stage 2 crower cam and skunk2 n obx adj cam gear (i'll prolly use 
>the obx). (you should hear the car idle with this in, it sounds like a 
>pumped camaro). You need the adj gear cuz the aftermarket crower cam 
>required a 4 degree valve timing advance.
>   e.. Racing valve springs and billet retainers (which I need for the high 
>rev cam)
>   f.. Lightened crank pulley.
>   g.. Aem power pulley set.
>   h.. ACT Prolite Flywheel (8.2lbs vs the stock 2x as heavy flywheel)
>   i.. ACT Heavy duty pressure plate and and stage 2 street/strip fiber 
>pad)
>   j.. Stronger Fuel Delivery with an STR fuel rail
>   k.. AEM adj fuel regulator with liquid guage
>   l.. Accel High Flow fuel injectors (and 2 sets of the stock ones)
>   m.. I just bought a stage 2 port/polished head thats port matched, 
>intake/exh. This will be the 3rd head I've picked up, one from the 
>junkyard, one from ebay, and the stocker was ported by myself, but the 
>aluminum was kinda tore up from tightening/loosening bolts so much.The 
>ported one comes with cam, springs etc. . so I'm curious to see what kind 
>since the guy didn't mention much about the cam, and I was mainly just 
>interested in the ported head.
>   n.. I cleaned the ports in my intake manifold a lil, had to replace my 
>MAP sensor/Knock Sensor/Throttle pos sensor/vtec pressure switch. I cleaned 
>up/smoothed out the throttle body assembly and matched it with the intake 
>mannie port.
>   o.. A gorgeous set of headers by SSAutochrome (an ebay company)
>   p.. OBX racing cat
>   q.. APEXi N1 Design muffler
>   r.. All the exhaust will be connected with 2.5-3" pipe by RPM mufflers 
>in hayward
>   s.. Engine supported by stronger polyeurethane bushing/mounts
>   t.. I "had" a dope lil oil pan from moroso, but even tho everyone told 
>me it would fit my car they don't actually make a pan for the D16 motor (if 
>someone knows someone who custom makes these let me know)
>   u.. JDM JUN Racing obd1 ecu with a skunk2 eprom (which I think might be 
>for a B16 motor but it works great still)
>   v.. Some new wiring here n there, some custom things like valve cover.
>   w.. Single piece obx style chrome cold air intake (I actually made one 
>of these to suck in air from the Right bumper vent (which I cut out days 
>ago).The one I bought sucks from the same place, but is a smoother one 
>piece design.
>   x.. Theres one piece I can't find anywhere on any other car like mine 
>that's called something like an Air Helper Valve. . .I don't know why I 
>have it but I haven't found a d16 motor with the same thing yet. Supposedly 
>it senses coolant temp and lets air flow from the crankcase into the intake 
>at higher temperatures. I think I can just plug it up. ??
>   y.. I'm waiting for a stock oil pan to come in the mail. They're cast, 
>and a piece broke off my old one.
>   z.. I had to replace the stock oil pump (which is a pretty simple 
>contraption). I wish I did this with the first rebuild, because aparrently 
>it was the major cause of the first engine issue and i didn't realize I 
>needed a new one till I took the engine apart like 4 more times (which I've 
>gotten pretty good at). My engine initially seized cuz oil wasn't making it 
>all the way to cyl#4 (the farthest one), or up to the camshaft area.  So 
>pretty much everything seized after a lil while of driving with an engine 
>knock I couldn't find till I seized the motor. I could just imagine how 
>much a dealer would charge to fix it.
>   aa.. Putting everything to the ground is the shifting upgrades I made 
>(simple but they make hell of a difference).
>   ab.. Polyeurethane shifter bushings.
>   ac.. Skunk2 Weighted short shifter and shift knob
>Chassis/Body/Suspenion-
>   a.. Tokico struts on all 4 corners
>   b.. Racing Dual Spring Coilovers (which are SOOOO much better than the 
>single spring setup, which I also have a set of). The dual springs make 
>sure you don't have the slop from the spring to spring cap gap. More 
>controlled.
>   c.. In the rear I installed a nifty lil camber kit which I bought off 
>some dude on ebay for like $8. A great idea actually. . .he put together a 
>set of shims (heavy duty washers) and longer bolts, that changed the angle 
>of the rear control arms. It works awesome. . .that guy had a good idea 
>from selling a couple bolts and some washers on ebay.Adjustable too.
>   d.. Upper front and rear strut tower braces
>   e.. Lower front and rear control arm braces
>   f.. The rear control arm brace was removed and I installed a Lightspeed 
>Racing rear sway bar. (the stock civic other than the si doesn't have one).
>Other than those things, I've been repainting my bumbers, I have a couple 
>sets of halo projector lights. . .diff guage cluster. . .led lights. . 
>.dyed my interior. . .replaced the stock steering wheel. . .painted the 
>interior plastic. . .
>
>mmmm. . .
>I can't wait till I can actually drive it.
>it's gonna be a fun ass car.
>I actually want to get into racing, like course racing not drag.
>
>so yeah, I just felt like talking. . .
>
>: )
>
>aK

Subject: [sfraves] Went to the psytrance party in Oakland (tribal flux)

------=_NextPart_000_0029_01C3E882.34EDD460
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Oh my god, I am so exhausted but happy, I danced for 5 hours straight at =
the Tribal Flux psytrance party in Oakland tonight. It was great fun!

The party was at the Noodle Factory, and it was being put on by the raw =
heaven crew. They are trying to raise money for a sound system to be =
used in the upcoming full moon raves (outdoor parties) when the weather =
improves.=20

So, if you weren't there, you missed a fun underground. Good music, good =
people. Also, they had lots of nice artwork that looked fantastic in the =
black lights.

I kept running back and forth between the two rooms of sound, one =
upstairs and one downstairs (psytrance vs. breakbeats). I have to say =
that I really enjoyed the breakbeats, maybe even more than the trance!=20

I guess my musical tastes are changing a bit, although I like all forms =
of EDM. One good thing about this party is that it wasn't too crowded so =
there was room to dance, and I like that a lot.

Anyway, I am off to get some rest, hope I don't get leg cramps this =
morning, I forgot to stretch! I girl at the party told me to eat some =
bananas! (she said they have something that helps you after dancing =
hard).

Greg VP

------=_NextPart_000_0029_01C3E882.34EDD460--

Starting off a new trend, Dirtbox Radio will begin each month with the Kru
holdin it down.  Tonight we start it off with Shade and Akasha rollin thru
to shake it up.

07-08pm EST - ODJ & Jerel - Yer hosts warm it up like what!  Watch for new
dubs by Evancipation & Eskmo :)

08-09:30pm EST - Akasha - The man himself rolls in with the wickedness,
dropping nasty tech, breaky break, and his own original goodness.

09:30-11pm EST - Shade - One DJ with a very applicable name, Shade digs
and drops the dark and dirty.  A very talented DJ and a great guy this one
is, so don't miss!

11-12am+ EST - ODJ & Jerel - Takin you out of the night with the munted
goodness we is...

minutes to prepare for the nastiness.

Subject: [sfraves] *Forever Young* Gracias Muchachos!

ryan, michael, brandon, ray, naru, steve0, shawn and
philip - the cheese oozed, people in lace gloves and
sculpted non-grata aqua net do's wept, the music was
*everything* i had hoped for - THANK YOU.  the sets
were recorded and should be online in mp3 format by
now - a link will be posted soon (unless it already
has and then i'm a dork but whatev ;))

for everyone who came in costume, for everyone who
came with a good vibe, for everyone who came with
their own booze - ROCK THE F*CK ON!  i haven't seen
that much enthusiasm for a costume affair in a long
long long time - here's some of the crowd:

http://homepage.mac.com/shawn.allen/ForeverYoung/

there wasn't enough memory to capture *everyone*, but
that was the original intent, so apologies for those
that didn't get immortalized.

for the record, this wasn't a TL party, it just thrown
at the TL space.  this party was thrown by members of
different crews - all good friends with a common goal
in showing you a good time, and it sounds like our
mission, was like, accomplished!  jessi, delia, osby,
amber, audra, erica, erik, aaron & philip - you all
make me feel fuzzy :)

thanks again everyone, i've got a week of sleep to
catch up on, so later ;)

shelley

racing, course racing, I suggest hooking up with the local SCCA autocross

learn a lot real quick and get a thrill ride. =D

Subject: Re: [sfraves] *Forever Young* Gracias Muchachos!

All I can say is that I rarely go out anymore due to parties just lacking
energy and quality. I had a fucking blast at the 80's party. What really did
it for me were the people that came. To see so many people actually put in
the effort to dress up blew me away. Usually if you go to a themed party you
get a handful of people that dress up while the rest don't bother. I'd say
90% of the ~200 people there were dressed up! Now toss in the excitement and
happiness that was flowing through the place and you got yourself one hell
of a night. It was great to see damn near all of my friends under one roof
again. Seems like that occurance happens about 4 times a year at best and
gets harder and harder to pull off.

It kinda scared me how I knew the lyrics to nearly everything played. Yeah
I'm definitely a child of the 80's. Osby needs to become a hair dresser and
go to beauty school. Doesn't that job just fit him perfectly?? You should
see the pictures and look at my gf's hair. That was complements of Osby.
Apparently Michael and Eric were getting their freak on while I was playing.
I just remember Eric stripping my wife beater off me. Kinda had to pay
attention to what I was doing since I had some technical issues that didn't
allow me to have any cue function. Go spinning with no headphones! haha.

Much love to all in the Retro group that made this happen and especially to
Shelley who masterminded the event. It worked out better than I think we
could have imagined! The place looked great from the 80's toys to the Kudos
and the special *spiked* punch that was made. I'll toss out a thank you to
the TL people for gritting their teeth and putting up with some bad 80's
music in their place. Much appreciated for your hospitality.

I'll post my pictures in a bit. I'm cringing at the thought of hearing my
set....

:: r y a n :: (yahoo.serious)


----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Calamity Jane" <scarpetta80@yahoo.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Monday, February 02, 2004 9:03 AM
Subject: [sfraves] *Forever Young* Gracias Muchachos!


ryan, michael, brandon, ray, naru, steve0, shawn and
philip - the cheese oozed, people in lace gloves and
sculpted non-grata aqua net do's wept, the music was
*everything* i had hoped for - THANK YOU.  the sets
were recorded and should be online in mp3 format by
now - a link will be posted soon (unless it already
has and then i'm a dork but whatev ;))

for everyone who came in costume, for everyone who
came with a good vibe, for everyone who came with
their own booze - ROCK THE F*CK ON!  i haven't seen
that much enthusiasm for a costume affair in a long
long long time - here's some of the crowd:

http://homepage.mac.com/shawn.allen/ForeverYoung/

there wasn't enough memory to capture *everyone*, but
that was the original intent, so apologies for those
that didn't get immortalized.

for the record, this wasn't a TL party, it just thrown
at the TL space.  this party was thrown by members of
different crews - all good friends with a common goal
in showing you a good time, and it sounds like our
mission, was like, accomplished!  jessi, delia, osby,
amber, audra, erica, erik, aaron & philip - you all
make me feel fuzzy :)

thanks again everyone, i've got a week of sleep to
catch up on, so later ;)

shelley

Subject: [sfraves] ATP: REVIEW: John Creamer & Stephane K @ 1015 on Friday

------=_NextPart_000_0116_01C3E97C.54153B80
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

So...I will warn everyone that I am a total Creamer groupie, so getting =
to see them together was a major thing for me!

Showed up about 10:30 or so with a friend of mine and first thing I =
noticed was, there was nooo line...place was dead. With VIP pass in hand =
was ushered through the security probe without incident. Entered the =
club and grabbed a few cocktails. Some nice breaks going on in the main =
room...went to the restroom and on my way out started laying down flyers =
for the progression event. Some security guy saw me and said, 'hey, what =
party is that for?", I said for a monthly at 26Mix. He collected all the =
flyers I laid down and told me I couldn't pass anything out unless it =
was for 1015....um Hello2Day? I was completely floored; what do you mean =
I can't promote my party? They place was wallpapered with 1015 flyers, =
how was little ol me gonna take away from that? Anyway, my party is on a =
totally different night..Anyway, I was pissed. WAY TO SUPPORT THE SCENE =
1015...So I headed upstairs and still set flyers down...then the guy who =
sweeps up, started throwing my shit away...at that point, I was =
determined to beat these guys. I clocked the patterns of the guy who =
traveled through the rooms and followed behind him laying my stuff =
down...Even if my flyers were exposed to one person I felt value in =
that..so it was kind of a little game for me...Even though the flyers =
only lasted about 10 minutes in anyone location..I did see people =
picking them up, so that was cool.

Then the main room opened. Mr. Ojeda laid a nice little warm-up set =
down, playing a lot of the new tunes that have been coming out as of =
late. Great vibe. I enjoyed it even more because the club was =
empty...only about 80 people in any one room at any given point. So, =
tons of space to dance and chill. So there I am with beer in hand, and =
who do I see? Why my man JC! Great to see a familiar face. So we start =
rappin and this etard totally pukes right in front of us...like c'mon =
sweetie it's only 10:30 slow down. We had a good laugh about that. =
Always funny to see a girl dressed to kill, with her Ibiza shades on, =
all down up totally ralphing..how lady like. ;)

The moment of truth came at 1:30 when Mr. Creamer entered the booth. Him =
and K setup their Apply laptop and ran a mixer right from the comp. =
Hadn't seen that before. Unfortunately, the comp crashed in the middle =
of the 3rd song. I think this was a turning point, 'cause I am guessing =
that they were gonna play some new material, but after that it was =
mostly cd's and vinyl for the remainder of the night. So, I don't think =
what they played was the 'intended set'. Regardless it was throbbing =
progressive onslaught. Stayed on the floor until about 3:30 and them me =
legs just about fell off. So had to call it a night.=20

To make it even better, I totally got to meet them...really nice guys. =
So with Demo in hand, I passed it along to them [finger's crossed]. Be =
nice to get some feedback from them, so we will see. Overall had a =
blast. The only negative thing, is ONCE again, the asshole security and =
them hatin' on other parties. It is inconceivable how a place can say =
they support EDM, and then not allow exposure for local dj's. Definitely =
bad karma for those guys.=20
--
DJ Jack Triumph
Minister of Infinite Progressive Onslaught
_____________________________________
"I saw an Angel in the Marble,=20
and carved until I set him free"
- Michelangelo

jack@jacktriumph.com
www.jacktriumph.com

Yahoo: Jack_Triumph
MSN: jacktriumph@hotmail.com

Hahaha I had a lot of fun too- but everyone's track
selection makes me curious-

Am I the only weirdo who was listening mainly to Rap
in the 80's?
I mean, I dug on some New Order and Depesche Mode back
then but most of my listening was Public Enemy, NWA,
Ice-T, MC Hammer, Beastie Boys, 2-live Crew, Too
Short, Rob Base, Fresh Prince kinda stuff. From
1986-1990 that was it.

Then I got in to the older shit- Grandmaster Flash etc
just to see where it all came from.
And a little Metallica too hahahh :)

would go to 3.05.04 Sparks, NV @ New Oasis the only reason is this... they said on 
Fuse TV. "everone and anyone that has are new CD or Record we will hang out 
with you and sing your music for free."

i am so there

http://remixmag.com/ar/remix_crystal_method_kicks/

-------------------------------1075755805--

From: "Nathan Seven" <scosol@yahoo.com>

Hahaha I had a lot of fun too- but everyone's track
selection makes me curious-

Am I the only weirdo who was listening mainly to Rap
in the 80's?
I mean, I dug on some New Order and Depesche Mode back
then but most of my listening was Public Enemy, NWA,
Ice-T, MC Hammer, Beastie Boys, 2-live Crew, Too
Short, Rob Base, Fresh Prince kinda stuff. From
1986-1990 that was it.

Then I got in to the older shit- Grandmaster Flash etc
just to see where it all came from.
And a little Metallica too hahahh :)


--- innocentchild <innocentchild@hotmail.com> wrote:
> All I can say is that I rarely go out anymore due to
> parties just lacking
> energy and quality. I had a fucking blast at the
> 80's party. What really did
> it for me were the people that came. To see so many
> people actually put in
> the effort to dress up blew me away. Usually if you
> go to a themed party you
> get a handful of people that dress up while the rest
> don't bother. I'd say
> 90% of the ~200 people there were dressed up! Now
> toss in the excitement and
> happiness that was flowing through the place and you
> got yourself one hell
> of a night. It was great to see damn near all of my
> friends under one roof
> again. Seems like that occurance happens about 4
> times a year at best and
> gets harder and harder to pull off.
>
> It kinda scared me how I knew the lyrics to nearly
> everything played. Yeah
> I'm definitely a child of the 80's. Osby needs to
> become a hair dresser and
> go to beauty school. Doesn't that job just fit him
> perfectly?? You should
> see the pictures and look at my gf's hair. That was
> complements of Osby.
> Apparently Michael and Eric were getting their freak
> on while I was playing.
> I just remember Eric stripping my wife beater off
> me. Kinda had to pay
> attention to what I was doing since I had some
> technical issues that didn't
> allow me to have any cue function. Go spinning with
> no headphones! haha.
>
> Much love to all in the Retro group that made this
> happen and especially to
> Shelley who masterminded the event. It worked out
> better than I think we
> could have imagined! The place looked great from the
> 80's toys to the Kudos
> and the special *spiked* punch that was made. I'll
> toss out a thank you to
> the TL people for gritting their teeth and putting
> up with some bad 80's
> music in their place. Much appreciated for your
> hospitality.
>
> I'll post my pictures in a bit. I'm cringing at the
> thought of hearing my
> set....
>
> :: r y a n :: (yahoo.serious)
>
>
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: "Calamity Jane" <scarpetta80@yahoo.com>

>
> ryan, michael, brandon, ray, naru, steve0, shawn and
> philip - the cheese oozed, people in lace gloves and
> sculpted non-grata aqua net do's wept, the music was
> *everything* i had hoped for - THANK YOU.  the sets
> were recorded and should be online in mp3 format by
> now - a link will be posted soon (unless it already
> has and then i'm a dork but whatev ;))
>
> for everyone who came in costume, for everyone who
> came with a good vibe, for everyone who came with
> their own booze - ROCK THE F*CK ON!  i haven't seen
> that much enthusiasm for a costume affair in a long
> long long time - here's some of the crowd:
>
> http://homepage.mac.com/shawn.allen/ForeverYoung/
>
> there wasn't enough memory to capture *everyone*,
> but
> that was the original intent, so apologies for those
> that didn't get immortalized.
>
> for the record, this wasn't a TL party, it just
> thrown
> at the TL space.  this party was thrown by members
> of
> different crews - all good friends with a common
> goal
> in showing you a good time, and it sounds like our
> mission, was like, accomplished!  jessi, delia,
> osby,
> amber, audra, erica, erik, aaron & philip - you all
> make me feel fuzzy :)
>
> thanks again everyone, i've got a week of sleep to
> catch up on, so later ;)

Subject: [sfraves] Free Party!!! (bsp) Oneiromancy Feb 6th

hi folks.

I'm going to be playing at a party this Friday from 10pm-11pm. Come early!!! 
I'm giving away copies of my demo. Peace!

-Paul
dj_choco@hotmail.com
http://www.prolificdjs.com
-----------------------------------------------------

Oneiromancy.02.06.04.

Due to a high demand, there is a very limited number of reserved tickets to 
this party. Because the event is first-come, first-serve, a lot of people 
who work late or can't get to the venue early have asked for this. A reserve 
ticket is $5, and will guarantee you a spot.

If you don't want to pay, you still have that option, but we will close off 
the party when it hits capacity, no matter what.

If you want to buy a reserve ticket, you can visit http://www.wavelength.dj 
, and pay by paypal.
-----------------------------------------------

Timeslots:
10-11:
Choco (Trance, Prolific DJs, San Jose/Milpitas)
Thomas Kent (House/Prog)
Aaron Jae (Breaks/Jungle)
Mareo Diaz (Hard)
Varitech (Techno)

11-12:
Alysn (Trance)
Deft (House/Prog)
Nick Nyquil (Breaks/Jungle, Oneiromancy, SAC)
Joshuah (Hard)
Ethan (Techno, Friends $ Family, SF)

12-1:
Majere (Trance, Elektrosorcery, SF)
Greg J (House/Prog, Funky Cactus SF, Bassrush LA)
Audio1 (Jungle, Urban Drums, SF)
Covert (Hard)
Sarah Fab (Techno, Stay Up Forever/Vynil Vixens, UK)

1-2:
Tenchi (Trance, Bionic Bubbles, SF)
Cantos (Prog/House, Stilldream Collective, SAC)
The Doctor (Jungle, BayRaves, SF)
No Left Turn (Hard, Liquid Vynil, SF)
DDR (Techno, Stay Up Forever/Haschem, UK)

2-3:
Andrew Kelly (Trance)
Dave K (House/Prog, Family Funktions, SAC)
Upsoe (Jungle)
Achilles (Hard, D&A Music, SF/Las Vegas)
GAMMA (Techno)

3-4:
Apot ([Hard] Trance, Abysmal Frequencies, SF)
Resistance (House)
Arize (Jungle)
Reclipse (Hard, Bay Raves, SF)
Mek (Techno)

This event is 100% free - however, it is not a free-for-all. Don't bring 
your drugs, weapons, bottles, and other things you wouldn't normally bring 
to a party. Cameras of course, are permitted.

Capacity is extremely limited. More on this in the coming days.
Visit http://www.wavelength.dj , for more info on reserved tickets, 
directions, info line, etc.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: NRR: Ranking candidates according to your own views

Philip,

	This is the problem: If they're willing to lie and manipulate the 
voters in order to get into office, they're probably NOT going to be 
working for real change. Once they've abandoned integrity to that 
extent, even as a means to a higher end, they'll likely find the 
rewards offered by playing along too enticing to buck the system in a 
major way.

	It's like expecting that a promoter who's been putting his efforts 
into building a big following all year by throwing soulless, 
commercial, indiscriminately promoted massives with the usual thuggish 
security, music catering to the lowest common denominator, dubious 
business practices, etc., is suddenly going to come through with a 
terrific low-cost New Year's Eve underground with loving people and a 
great vibe.

Groove on,
						<<< Starchild >>>

X-Sender: apollo@mail.speakeasy.net
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Version 6.0.1.1
Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2004 17:10:39 -0800
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_20350342==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Forever Young!!!

--=====================_20350342==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Major props to Shelley for throwing this kick-ass party!!!  This was her 
first go at creating and producing an event, and I think she did a 
magnificent job.  For those of you who may not know Shelley she is a 
Renaissance woman:  an artist; singer (she studied opera); accomplished DJ 
(aka Calamity Jane); and now successful party giver.

I had a wonderful time at "Forever Young."  It was a really relaxing 
evening for me socializing with a multitude of old friends and meeting some 
new people in the flesh, like Marc(O).  I was literally loved right down to 
the floor by one friend I haven't seen for awhile a few minutes after I 
arrived:)

The music was all much fun, and reminded me how many "pop" tunes that 
received radio play in those days actually made it to the dance floor.  I 
would like to have heard some hip hop and much more industrial but 
hey...not complaining.  Especially liked Philip, Redstickman, and Shawn's sets.

It's always refreshing to revisit the past.  There is an associative 
quality to old music that brings a flood of memories to the fore...for 
better or worse.  Although the eighties was not one of my favorite decades, 
EDM was "invented" then and last month marked the twentieth anniversary of 
the release of the first house recording, "On and On" (January, 1984).

Thank you, Shelley, and your most excellent crew, for taking us all on this 
musical trip to the past.

Love,

Apollo


Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Fascism should more properly be called corporatism because it is the 
merger of state and corporate power."
-Benito Mussolini

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] ATP: Giving Credit where credit's Due; my continuing bitch session about online vinyl stores

------=_NextPart_000_026D_01C3E9B5.1E603600
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

So, most of you got a chance to see me vent last week about buying tunes =
online. Well truth be told I got a lot of response, people pointing me =
in different directions or offering advice. As usual the SFR family is =
there with a solution.

Well one of those solutions was VitalVinyl.com - Now they didn't have =
about 40 of the records I search for, in stock, but they did have about =
7 that I grabbed...So I ordered, figuring I would give it a shot. Well =
today I am sitting at my computer thinking 'Gee, when are my tunes gonna =
come'...I didn't even remember getting the usual email 'o death from =
them saying "well, we only have 1 or your tunes" aka the typical =
satellite records email.=20

So, I logged into my account and THEY SHIPPED ALL MY RECORDS...no "we =
falsely advertised this", or "well it takes 7 days to fill the order." =
They just sent 'em..so we will see. I am not sure if this is the =
solution, but I thought I would share my experience with you =
guys...'cause I know sometimes it seems like I bitch alot, but I also =
like to take the chance to compliment quality =
companies/products/dj's/parties (Yes, forever young ROCKED!)

Also. while their 'samples' are Real Player based...the let you heard =
the entire song, or so at least has been my experience.

jack out.
--
DJ Jack Triumph
Minister of Infinite Progressive Onslaught

and carved until I set him free"
- Michelangelo

DJ Pisces Playlist, Feb 2004
01. Roy Davis Jr. - About Love (Solid Groove Remix) - Classic
02. Hakan Lidbo - Changes (Original Mix) - Cartridge
03. Haffa Combino - Hjulbent - Primate
04. Adam Beyer and Joel Mull - Remainings III - Drumcode
05. Percy X - Maintain - Soma
06. Geoff White - Student Teacher (Dailogue Rework) - Morris Audio Citysport 
Edition
07. Hardcell - Mental Notch - CLR
08. Geeez 'n Gosh - Nobody Knows - Mille Plateaux
09. Baby Ford - Built In - Force Inc.
10. Paolo Veneziani - Inside The Edge (Berlin Mix) - Cobalt CDR
For DJ Pisces Bookings, Please contact Timothy Dorsey or Tony Russo


Tony Russo
Cobalt Recordings
Co-owner
Bookings,Events, Promotions

www.cobaltrecordings.tk

Subject: [sfraves] oliver lieb, 1015, this friday 2/6

ok, i know most people on here 1) don't care about oliver lieb and 2) won't 
go to 1015.

in fact, i think me and mr. mike are the only dorks intersted in hearing 
him.  but here's deal for me....i really like Oliver Lieb's production.  
it's good shit.  progressive yet techy, melodic yet deep...a lot of elements 
i like.

so like, i never ever hear of this guy coming to san francisco.  for all i 
know, this is the one and only time he's played in SF in the last 4-5 years 
(i know i've been keeping my ears open for him for atleast the past 3 years 
and have never seen him on a flyer or BSP).  every other DJ i've ever really 
wanted to hear has atleast come through SF in the past couple years (minus 
plump djs and stanton warriors).  so now oliver lieb finally comes.

1015 on friday.  i'm tempted.  *sigh*  anyone want to go with me?

----- Original Message -----
From: Brandon S. <invibe@hotmail.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Monday, February 02, 2004 7:20 PM
Subject: [sfraves] oliver lieb, 1015, this friday 2/6


ok, i know most people on here 1) don't care about oliver lieb and 2) won't
go to 1015.

in fact, i think me and mr. mike are the only dorks intersted in hearing
him.  but here's deal for me....i really like Oliver Lieb's production.
it's good shit.  progressive yet techy, melodic yet deep...a lot of elements
i like.

so like, i never ever hear of this guy coming to san francisco.  for all i
know, this is the one and only time he's played in SF in the last 4-5 years
(i know i've been keeping my ears open for him for atleast the past 3 years
and have never seen him on a flyer or BSP).  every other DJ i've ever really
wanted to hear has atleast come through SF in the past couple years (minus
plump djs and stanton warriors).  so now oliver lieb finally comes.

1015 on friday.  i'm tempted.  *sigh*  anyone want to go with me?

BUt man... he was like putting on these groovy tracks & like playing w/ the mixer soin all these things 2 ever song he mixed in that totally fucked up ever song in a good way though... LoL... It was a fun night totally!! Man. I wish. This girl made me go to a fucking baby-massive in SF instead.

I DID get to see AK1200, who I've never seen before. That was dope. Had me

though. Kelly's mission rock is a craphole, and the crowd as uber cheese.
Not to mention they jacked us on admission.

threw it. Totally unmemorable, aside from AK.

The moral of this story, kids? Stick with the underground. :b

On Sun, 1 Feb 2004, Greg Van Pelt wrote:

> Oh my god, I am so exhausted but happy, I danced for 5 hours straight at the Tribal Flux psytrance party in Oakland tonight. It was great fun!
>
> The party was at the Noodle Factory, and it was being put on by the raw heaven crew. They are trying to raise money for a sound system to be used in the upcoming full moon raves (outdoor parties) when the weather improves.
>
> So, if you weren't there, you missed a fun underground. Good music, good people. Also, they had lots of nice artwork that looked fantastic in the black lights.
>
> I kept running back and forth between the two rooms of sound, one upstairs and one downstairs (psytrance vs. breakbeats). I have to say that I really enjoyed the breakbeats, maybe even more than the trance!
>
> I guess my musical tastes are changing a bit, although I like all forms of EDM. One good thing about this party is that it wasn't too crowded so there was room to dance, and I like that a lot.
>
> Anyway, I am off to get some rest, hope I don't get leg cramps this morning, I forgot to stretch! I girl at the party told me to eat some bananas! (she said they have something that helps you after dancing hard).
>
> Greg VP
>

Date: Tue, 3 Feb 2004 12:37:45 -0800

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2800.1158
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1165
Message-ID: <BAY9-DAV43qWM6Z0wHb000537aa@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 03 Feb 2004 20:36:16.0883 (UTC) FILETIME=[5F71DC30:01C3EA95]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Went to the psytrance party in Oakland (tribal flux)

Kelly's Mission Rock isn't a crap hole at all. I've been to a Thump party
there and it was completely done up. I've also been there for a big
collaborative party between rythm method, cloudfactory, and fnf which was
TOTALLY done up. Now crappy there for the drugs and *to go party* types.

It really comes down to the crowd. You could throw a party in the biggest
shit hole of a venue (think run down) but if you bring in a crowd that's
there for the music and each other and have a solid lineup then all is good.
The venue just becomes background. To say that KMR is a craphole because the
crowd and music sucked isn't fair or accurate.

I go out based on the crowd that will be at the event. If I know a promoter
tends to draw a crowd that I don't like I stay away. Know your promoters and
the type of events they throw and the crowd they cater to.

Oh and I think it was that quasi-wmc event that was getting plastered all
over SFRaves. Wasn't it bayraves (feat. members of coolworld) put the event
on?

:: r ::

> The party was at the Noodle Factory, and it was being put on by the raw
heaven crew. They are trying to raise money for a sound system to be used in
the upcoming full moon raves (outdoor parties) when the weather improves.
>
> So, if you weren't there, you missed a fun underground. Good music, good
people. Also, they had lots of nice artwork that looked fantastic in the
black lights.
>
> I kept running back and forth between the two rooms of sound, one upstairs
and one downstairs (psytrance vs. breakbeats). I have to say that I really
enjoyed the breakbeats, maybe even more than the trance!
>
> I guess my musical tastes are changing a bit, although I like all forms of
EDM. One good thing about this party is that it wasn't too crowded so there
was room to dance, and I like that a lot.
>
> Anyway, I am off to get some rest, hope I don't get leg cramps this
morning, I forgot to stretch! I girl at the party told me to eat some
bananas! (she said they have something that helps you after dancing hard).
>
> Greg VP
>

Bcc: 
Date: Tue, 03 Feb 2004 13:45:35 -0800
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <Sea1-F961qdiixjnzi90003a713@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 03 Feb 2004 21:45:35.0883 (UTC) FILETIME=[0E66E5B0:01C3EA9F]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Went to the psytrance party in Oakland (tribal flux)

Actually some promoter guys from Arizona I believe.. - Surreal Entertainment 
or something like that. I played for these guys with Michael Liu in AZ when 
they did an Earthdance benefit in 2000. Great show down there and they 
treated us well.

I played at Kelly's late on Saturday night in the downstairs house/trance 
room after Reckless Ryan, who (on a different note) is pretty damn reckless 
if I do say so myself... somehow he turned off all the speakers except for 
the monitor for about 5 minutes, and then very shortly after that, he 
dropped the mixer off the table and onto his feet, unplugging everything in 
the process.. there was dead sound for about 10 minutes until Michael Liu 
saved the day and plugged everything back in.. The crowd had pretty much 
lost interest by that point.. I'm not really sure what happened, but I 
didn't have any technical issues at all during my set. Mike played after me 
and did fine too.

but anyway, I agree that Kelly's isn't a craphole and also agree that a 
party (or at least it's vibe) is all in the crowd. I wasn't there long.. but 
it didn't seem they did too bad for their first SF venture.. (judging purely 
on numbers - I was there to create vibe and I'd like to think I did a good 
job with what I had to work with). Overall, I think the party certainly 
lacked the vibe of an intimate rocker like Forever Young.. but you often do 
with 4 rooms of different music.

{btw, I recorded my set if anyone wants to hear it.. raw, unedited, bumps, 
skips and all.. it's heavier house with a bit-o-breaks... email me for a 
CD.}

Get House,

-Justin Hale

>shit hole of a venue (think run down) but if you bring in a crowd that's
>there for the music and each other and have a solid lineup then all is 
>good.
>The venue just becomes background. To say that KMR is a craphole because 
>the
>crowd and music sucked isn't fair or accurate.

>tends to draw a crowd that I don't like I stay away. Know your promoters 
>and

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Went to the psytrance party in Oakland (tribal flux)

My mistake. Hearing crap like this is what disenchants me more and more with
the general masses out in the party world. For the most part it seems it's a
reckless bunch that comes to get fucked up and leave. I now know that a more
underground, limited promotion based event is all I want. I'm not even going
to compare this event with the 80's party. Completely different animals. I
could compare the event you played at to the fund raiser at SomArts this
past summer that FnF put on. Multi-room with lots of space that would
normally thin out a crowd or kill a vibe. Difference being the people that
attend events like the FnF party create such an amazing energy that you
never feel a room is lacking.

It's like window shopping. They only see what's in that big store window.

Sorry you had to be a part of that mess!

:: r ::

be removed from their lists.

who do I have to have killed in order to stop these. ..=20

anyone else have these problems ?

I'm glad I have norton. . .=20

Subject: [sfraves] SFLNC:  Support Later Last Call Hours

--=====================_1813798==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

WHAT:  1. Write an email in support of extending last call hours for alcohol
              2. Come to the hearing at the Board of Supervisors

WHEN: 1. Write the email now to the addresses listed below.
             2. Come to the hearing on Thursday, Feb 5th at 9:30 am.
                 <http://sfgov.org/site/bdsupvrs_page.asp?id=13954>http://sfgov.org/site/bdsupvrs_page.asp?id=13954

WHERE:  City Services Committee of the Board of Supervisors, City Hall, Rm. 263

The SFLNC needs your support for a proposal that could have huge benefits 
for the entertainment scene in San Francisco.

Supervisor Aaron Peskin has introduced a resolution encouraging State 
Assemblymember Mark Leno to develop legislation that could extend the last 
call for alcohol in bars, restaurants and nightclubs in California's 
largest Cities.  This will give San Franciscans and visitors to our City 
similar rights to those enjoyed in New York, Chicago, Miami, New Orleans 
and other large cities that allow alcohol sales after 2am.  This will also 
provide a much needed boost to our local entertainment scene and economy.

The SFLNC first introduced this resolution at the Entertainment Commission, 
which voted unanimously to support it.  Please read the resolution 
here:(<http://sfgov.org/site/uploadedfiles/bdsupvrs/committees/materials/040057.pdf>http://sfgov.org/site/uploadedfiles/bdsupvrs/committees/materials/040057.pdf).

In your email to our elected officials, it is crucial to include in the 
subject line the words "Support Later Last Call Hours".  Supervisors do not 
always read every email but they do count those for and against an 
issue.  If you wish to contact your District Supervisor by phone or fax, 
contact info is available at: 
<http://www.sfgov.org/site/bdsupvrs_index.asp>http://www.sfgov.org/site/bdsupvrs_index.asp

Here are some important points about this proposal:

* Later last call hours will help to keep San Francisco a world class city

* Later last call hours will create additional revenue for the city and the 
state of California

* San Franciscans should have the same rights as those in other major cities

* National Traffic Safety Association data indicates that later last call 
hours do not increase and may actually decrease the number of alcohol 
related traffic fatalities.

* This proposal applies ONLY to on-site alcohol sales at restaurants, bars, 
or nightclubs

* This proposal DOES NOT allow alcohol sales after 2am in supermarkets or 
liquor stores

* This proposal applies ONLY to restaurants, bars or nightclubs in 
districts zoned for late night businesses.

* This proposal DOES NOT override any local zoning controls.

Here are the email addresses of our local elected 
officials:  <mailto:Aaron.Peskin@sfgov.org>Aaron.Peskin@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:Jake.McGoldrick@sfgov.gov>Jake.McGoldrick@sfgov.gov; 
<mailto:Michela.Alioto-Pier@sfgov.org>Michela.Alioto-Pier@sfgov.or<mailto:Michela.Alioto-Pier@sfgov.org>g; 
<mailto:Fiona.Ma@sfgov.org>Fiona.Ma@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:Matt.Gonzalez@sfgov.org>Matt.Gonzalez@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:Chris.Daly@sfgov.org>Chris.Daly@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:Tony.Hall@sfgov.org>Tony.Hall@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:Bevan.Dufty@sfgov.org>Bevan.Dufty@sfgov.or<mailto:Bevan.Dufty@sfgov.org>g; 
<mailto:Tom.Ammiano@sfgov.org>Tom.Ammiano@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:Sophie.Maxwell@sfgov.org>Sophie.Maxwell@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:Gerardo.Sandoval@sfgov.org>Gerardo.Sandoval@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:gavin.newsom@sfgov.org>gavin.newsom@sfgov.org; 
<mailto:assemblymember.leno@assembly.ca.gov>assemblymember.leno@assembly.ca.gov; 
<mailto:assemblymember.yee@assembly.ca.gov>assemblymember.yee@assembly.ca.gov

Thanks for helping the SFLNC in making San Francisco FUN again.

Please join the SFLNC and support our continued efforts on behalf of San 
Francisco Nightlife.

<http://sflnc.com/index/donate/>http://sflnc.com/index/donate/



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFLNC:  Support Later Last Call Hours

heya

hmmm. . . not that I don't support the SFLNC. . . most people know I do. . .

but one of the last things I'd ever support would be anything regarding
alcohol, or something that lets people drink MORE.

I think (or would guess) that the reason there is a "last call" for alcohol,
and restrictions on selling alcohol after certain hours, would be for the
safety of the public.
Realistically, these limitations are a somewhat sensible time to have people
stop drinking. More than likely tho, even with those times, people still end
up driving home under the influence and are much much much more likely to
hurt or kill any random innocent person on their obviously compromised drive
home.

with the amount of drunken driving these days. . . the last thing anyone
really needs is to increase the likelihood of drunken accidents.
I understand it may help the entertainment scene in SF. I just think it's
just plain stupid to trade the potential lives of people for clubs to make
more money.

shit, everyone knows that one of the worst times to leave a party, is right
when everone else is. With people drunk or on whatever, and the mass of them
trying to go wherever at the same time, it can be a kind of dangerous chaos
at times. No wonder every time I would go to a club or party, someone ALWAYS
hit my car. . .

I would hope that this attempt from the SFLNC isn't fueled by "donations"
from people who would no doubt benefit from the passing of something like
this. Too many people these days "sell out" for money. Not enuf people these
days give a shit about the people they hurt doing it.

I'm not a drinker, I hate alcohol. I've seen and been in cars with
inebriated drivers and thankfully survived those experiences of going off
the road, etc. I see people do horrible and stupid things due to alcohol
moreso than any drug I've ever known of.

Its similar to how the US covers up issues with things like tainted meat,
etc. Because they gain financially from the distribution of it. It's all a
very saddening thought.

No matter what anyone says, the people involved supporting issues that lead
to the destruction of lives and health of others are majorely the ones with
the "bloody hands". Thats not saying that I don't support peoples freedom to
decide for themselves. But bars and clubs are the "pushers" of one of the
most dangerous chemicals used every day. And it's legal, despite the damage
it does. Why ? Cuz it makes them money. . .

I think it's a badd idea, and if I lived in SF I would write to my district
supervisor in support AGAINST it. Other than that tho, I'm all for
supporting clubs in ANY OTHER WAY (of which are many).

aK

> WHERE:  City Services Committee of the Board of Supervisors, City Hall,
Rm. 263
>
> The SFLNC needs your support for a proposal that could have huge benefits
> for the entertainment scene in San Francisco.
>
> Supervisor Aaron Peskin has introduced a resolution encouraging State
> Assemblymember Mark Leno to develop legislation that could extend the last
> call for alcohol in bars, restaurants and nightclubs in California's
> largest Cities.  This will give San Franciscans and visitors to our City
> similar rights to those enjoyed in New York, Chicago, Miami, New Orleans
> and other large cities that allow alcohol sales after 2am.  This will also
> provide a much needed boost to our local entertainment scene and economy.
>
> The SFLNC first introduced this resolution at the Entertainment
Commission,
> which voted unanimously to support it.  Please read the resolution
>
here:(<http://sfgov.org/site/uploadedfiles/bdsupvrs/committees/materials/040
057.pdf>http://sfgov.org/site/uploadedfiles/bdsupvrs/committees/materials/04
0057.pdf).
>
> In your email to our elected officials, it is crucial to include in the
> subject line the words "Support Later Last Call Hours".  Supervisors do
not
> always read every email but they do count those for and against an
> issue.  If you wish to contact your District Supervisor by phone or fax,
> contact info is available at:
>
<http://www.sfgov.org/site/bdsupvrs_index.asp>http://www.sfgov.org/site/bdsu
pvrs_index.asp
>
> Here are some important points about this proposal:
>
> * Later last call hours will help to keep San Francisco a world class city
>
> * Later last call hours will create additional revenue for the city and
the
> state of California
>
> * San Franciscans should have the same rights as those in other major
cities
>
> * National Traffic Safety Association data indicates that later last call
> hours do not increase and may actually decrease the number of alcohol
> related traffic fatalities.
>
> * This proposal applies ONLY to on-site alcohol sales at restaurants,
bars,
> or nightclubs
>
> * This proposal DOES NOT allow alcohol sales after 2am in supermarkets or
> liquor stores
>
> * This proposal applies ONLY to restaurants, bars or nightclubs in
> districts zoned for late night businesses.
>
> * This proposal DOES NOT override any local zoning controls.
>

At 07:16 PM 2/3/2004, aK wrote:
>heya
>
>hmmm. . . not that I don't support the SFLNC. . . most people know I do. . .
>
>but one of the last things I'd ever support would be anything regarding
>alcohol, or something that lets people drink MORE.
>
>No matter what anyone says, the people involved supporting issues that lead
>to the destruction of lives and health of others are majorely the ones with
>the "bloody hands". Thats not saying that I don't support peoples freedom to
>decide for themselves. But bars and clubs are the "pushers" of one of the
>most dangerous chemicals used every day. And it's legal, despite the damage
>it does. Why ? Cuz it makes them money. . .
>
>I think it's a badd idea, and if I lived in SF I would write to my district
>supervisor in support AGAINST it. Other than that tho, I'm all for
>supporting clubs in ANY OTHER WAY (of which are many).

I certainly understand your concerns, ak.  But the data suggests that 
extended hours for serving alcohol at clubs do not increase the rate of 
accidents and even may decrease the number of booze-related accidents 
(National Traffic Safety Association).

There are now a number of venues in the city with after hours 
arrangements.  Personally, I rarely attend club events these days.  Prefer 
the underground.  I drink very little and when I do I take a cab.  There is 
little in this for me, but I believe the consumer should be able to decided 
what he/she wants to do with free time and money, rather than be dictated 
to by some paternalistic government authority.  Further, I'd like to see 
more venues where I can dance into the wee hours with my bottle of water:)

Bottom line:  if you drive drunk at any time you're a fool.  I've been hit 
by drunken drivers twice -- both times during the afternoon hours.

Love,

Apollo

Subject: [sfraves] DAVID MANCUSO AND THE ART OF DEEJAYING WITHOUT DEEJAYING

--=====================_5490975==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

My friend Greg Wilson in the UK just published this interesting article on 
David Mancuso.  Greg was and is one of the innovators of electro funk.

DAVID MANCUSO AND THE ART OF DEEJAYING WITHOUT DEEJAYING
<http://www.gsmag.net/David_Mancuso/David_Mancuso.htm>http://www.gsmag.net/David_Mancuso/David_Mancuso.htm

This has just been included on GrandSlams website. I'd like to thank David 
Mancuso and also Tim Lawrence, the author of 'Love Saves The Day', for 
reading through it, in order for me to be double-sure that the factual 
detail was all correct. It was obviously important to me that the piece, 
which looks at the direct link between disco culture and the psychedelic 
60's, received David's full blessing.

Love,

Apollo


Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Fascism should more properly be called corporatism because it is the 
merger of state and corporate power."
-Benito Mussolini

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFLNC:  Support Later Last Call Hours

AK,

	While your concerns about alcohol are valid, that's not a reason to  
support the morality police! Things like education and peer counseling  
are the best ways to get people to drink responsibly, not heavy-handed  
laws. Those don't stop anyone, they only create a black market and  
waste resources. See more specific comments below...

					<<< Starchild >>>


On Tuesday, February 3, 2004, at 07:16  PM, aK wrote:

> heya
>
> hmmm. . . not that I don't support the SFLNC. . . most people know I  
> do. . .
>
> but one of the last things I'd ever support would be anything regarding
> alcohol, or something that lets people drink MORE.

	Darn! So much for my liver transplant...  (j/k)  8)

> I think (or would guess) that the reason there is a "last call" for  
> alcohol,
> and restrictions on selling alcohol after certain hours, would be for  
> the
> safety of the public.
> Realistically, these limitations are a somewhat sensible time to have  
> people
> stop drinking. More than likely tho, even with those times, people  
> still end
> up driving home under the influence and are much much much more likely  
> to
> hurt or kill any random innocent person on their obviously compromised  
> drive
> home.

	But AK, if you'd check out the resolution, it addresses this issue by  
pointing out that there is no indication that letting bars stay open  
later results in more drunk driving fatalities. If they could stay open  
all night, then people wouldn't be forced to leave and could stay until  
they had a chance to sober up, or until more public transit options  
were running in the morning or it was safer to walk home in the  
daylight.

> with the amount of drunken driving these days. . .

	Actually drunken driving accidents are way down.

>  the last thing anyone
> really needs is to increase the likelihood of drunken accidents.
> I understand it may help the entertainment scene in SF. I just think  
> it's
> just plain stupid to trade the potential lives of people for clubs to  
> make
> more money.

	It's not about money to me, it's about the right to make one's own  
choices as an adult and not have government treat us like irresponsible  
children.

> shit, everyone knows that one of the worst times to leave a party, is  
> right
> when everone else is. With people drunk or on whatever, and the mass  
> of them
> trying to go wherever at the same time, it can be a kind of dangerous  
> chaos
> at times. No wonder every time I would go to a club or party, someone  
> ALWAYS
> hit my car. . .

	No kidding! If there wasn't such an early closing time, fewer people  
would be trying to leave all at once!

> I would hope that this attempt from the SFLNC isn't fueled by  
> "donations"
> from people who would no doubt benefit from the passing of something  
> like
> this. Too many people these days "sell out" for money. Not enuf people  
> these
> days give a shit about the people they hurt doing it.
>
> I'm not a drinker, I hate alcohol. I've seen and been in cars with
> inebriated drivers and thankfully survived those experiences of going  
> off
> the road, etc. I see people do horrible and stupid things due to  
> alcohol
> moreso than any drug I've ever known of.
>
> Its similar to how the US covers up issues with things like tainted  
> meat,
> etc. Because they gain financially from the distribution of it. It's  
> all a
> very saddening thought.

	There is also the matter of the profits that government agencies like  
Alcohol & Beverage Control make by having more regulations to enforce.  
The regulations justify more personnel and funding for them (at our  
expense).

> No matter what anyone says, the people involved supporting issues that  
> lead
> to the destruction of lives and health of others are majorely the ones  
> with
> the "bloody hands". Thats not saying that I don't support peoples  
> freedom to
> decide for themselves. But bars and clubs are the "pushers" of one of  
> the
> most dangerous chemicals used every day. And it's legal, despite the  
> damage
> it does. Why ? Cuz it makes them money. . .

	If they were allowed to sell less dangerous drugs like marijuana and  
magic mushrooms, then they wouldn't have to rely on alcohol so much to  
stay in business.

> I think it's a badd idea, and if I lived in SF I would write to my  
> district
> supervisor in support AGAINST it. Other than that tho, I'm all for
> supporting clubs in ANY OTHER WAY (of which are many).

	Well, one other good way to support our rights is to ask your elected  
representatives to let promoters who have an agreement with the owner  
of a space put on a party or event there without having to beg  
permission from the authorities.

> aK
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----

>> WHERE:  City Services Committee of the Board of Supervisors, City  
>> Hall,

>>
>> The SFLNC needs your support for a proposal that could have huge  
>> benefits
>> for the entertainment scene in San Francisco.
>>
>> Supervisor Aaron Peskin has introduced a resolution encouraging State
>> Assemblymember Mark Leno to develop legislation that could extend the  
>> last
>> call for alcohol in bars, restaurants and nightclubs in California's
>> largest Cities.  This will give San Franciscans and visitors to our  
>> City
>> similar rights to those enjoyed in New York, Chicago, Miami, New  
>> Orleans
>> and other large cities that allow alcohol sales after 2am.  This will  
>> also
>> provide a much needed boost to our local entertainment scene and  
>> economy.
>>
>> The SFLNC first introduced this resolution at the Entertainment
> Commission,
>> which voted unanimously to support it.  Please read the resolution
>>
> here:(<http://sfgov.org/site/uploadedfiles/bdsupvrs/committees/ 
> materials/040
> 057.pdf>http://sfgov.org/site/uploadedfiles/bdsupvrs/committees/ 
> materials/04
> 0057.pdf).
>>
>> In your email to our elected officials, it is crucial to include in  
>> the
>> subject line the words "Support Later Last Call Hours".  Supervisors  
>> do
> not
>> always read every email but they do count those for and against an
>> issue.  If you wish to contact your District Supervisor by phone or  
>> fax,
>> contact info is available at:
>>
> <http://www.sfgov.org/site/bdsupvrs_index.asp>http://www.sfgov.org/ 
> site/bdsu
> pvrs_index.asp
>>
>> Here are some important points about this proposal:
>>
>> * Later last call hours will help to keep San Francisco a world class  
>> city
>>
>> * Later last call hours will create additional revenue for the city  
>> and
> the
>> state of California
>>
>> * San Franciscans should have the same rights as those in other major
> cities
>>
>> * National Traffic Safety Association data indicates that later last  
>> call
>> hours do not increase and may actually decrease the number of alcohol
>> related traffic fatalities.
>>
>> * This proposal applies ONLY to on-site alcohol sales at restaurants,
> bars,
>> or nightclubs
>>
>> * This proposal DOES NOT allow alcohol sales after 2am in  
>> supermarkets or
>> liquor stores
>>
>> * This proposal applies ONLY to restaurants, bars or nightclubs in
>> districts zoned for late night businesses.
>>
>> * This proposal DOES NOT override any local zoning controls.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr: email viruses. . .damn them

Actually, given the targets of the DOS attacks being launched by the 
two variants of this new "mydoom" virus, for the first time in quite a 
while I actually found myself wishing that I *DID* still have a peecee 
to get infected.

But, alas, being a Mac user, mydoom (and the chance to do my part to 
blast sco off the 'net) passed me by.  Then again, so did sobig, the 
love bug, melissa, and all the rest.

Funny thing...  out of curiosity one day, I opened up the list of 
viruses that my (Mac version, of course) copy of Norton scans for.  
Almost all of them are pc viruses which, should they somehow have 
gotten on my Mac in the first place, would have done exactly nothing to 
me.  But Norton was scanning for them anyway.  I guess they figure that 
an AV program has to do SOMETHING to earn its keep, even if that 
something is totally superfluous.


cya,
john

What this says to me is that too many whites are getting away with drug
use, too many whites are getting away with drug sales, too many whites
are getting away with trafficking in this stuff. The answer to this
disparity is not to start letting people out of jail because we're not
putting others in jail who are breaking the law. The answer is to go out
and find the ones who are getting away with it, convict them and send
them up the river, too."

	"Apollo" <apollo@speakeasy.org>

Date: Tue, 3 Feb 2004 21:08:44 -0800
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2800.1158
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1165
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFLNC:  Support Later Last Call Hours

heya

however much I disagree with laws in general, ones that are more pointed to
moderate a use of something rather than ban it all together actually
sometimes make sense to some extent.
I totally agree and support drug awareness/education. DanceSafe was one
organization with one of the absolute best missions i've ever seen in the
party world.
But if you think about it, whats supposed to happen to limit the negative
effects caused by people who aren't educated, soon to be educated, or maybe
never will be educated on the subject ? Like neither can ever fully replace
the other.

What is the real gain from extending drinking hours ?
More get drunk time ?
More money for the clubs ?
Really, if you think about it. If a club is still successfully open, and has
been for a long period of time. . . why are all of these people in support
of giving some person MORE money ? If it was a lil club that was barely
making it. . .is extending the drinking hours in that establishment going to
massively increase it's customer base, or it's income ?
You would think it's more money for the community. . . but it's more money
for the club, and less for the surrounding income based groups/orgs.
What good does it do for the community as a whole ?

it doesn't make sense to me. . .basically it's a business and not a govmt
related idea. It wasn't designed for your average corner store, but just
restaraunts and clubs (basically), so in reality it's only helping increase
the income of "some" community businesses. Why sell liquor after 2 or
whatever, where someone could walk immediately out from a drink and drive
away. . .when the store across the street can't, even tho the person would
face a more serious violation (open container + this etc) and (unless they
drank it on the way to their car) would not be drunk, alcohol can't be
sitting next to you, etc (not to mention the amount of minors in clubs who
drink, vs the difficulty buying from a store)?
If I was a storekeeper I'd feel it was very unfair.

It's not increasing any individuals freedom or right to do as they like with
their body. It's about regulating businesses to be responsible, and limit
the negative effects of a business on the surrounding community (considering
the mass amount of people frequenting). A small company can do a huge amount
of damage or a huge amount of good for a community. But regardless the
business should act upon a basic set of standards in place to protect the
surrounding area and more.

yes people should be responsible for themselves. . . of course. But even the
most responsible person has been irresponsible before, everybody has. But
this isn't an initiative pushing the education of drinking on the clubs
(which would make hell of a lot more sense than MORE drinking). . . it's an
initiative extending the supporting for drinking itself, not the education,
not the safer use of, but something to let people do as always, but for
longer. Which btw makes club and establishment owners who already make
money, make MORE money.

Supporting the clubs is all well and good. But if anything. . . why isn't
there an initiative on clubs by the SFLNC or someone that people support,
that requires some sort of education materials and services (including
required knowledge or testing for personnel handling/working with such
materials) by businesses dealing with those products ?
How many clubs have first aid kits ? Or trained cpr techs or anything near
that on hand ?
How many clubs or restaraunts do you know of that have any materials
promoting the safe use of alcohol, and not the "drink me" type ads ? (btw I
know these things have been tried, but not backed as much and afterwards
failed)

If I was a teacher. . .I'd give the kids instructions on how to use the
sharp object safely before I extended their playtime with it. . .

Community support organizations need to lay their own path, they need to
quit following ideas which are "mutually beneficial", and they need to risk
themselves and their word for the things that they actually believe in. The
whole things too political, when it shouldn't be.


huggs n stuff

: )

arycK

> >> * Later last call hours will help to keep San Francisco a world class
> >> city
> >>
> >> * Later last call hours will create additional revenue for the city
> >> and
> > the
> >> state of California
> >>
> >> * San Franciscans should have the same rights as those in other major
> > cities
> >>
> >> * National Traffic Safety Association data indicates that later last
> >> call
> >> hours do not increase and may actually decrease the number of alcohol
> >> related traffic fatalities.
> >>
> >> * This proposal applies ONLY to on-site alcohol sales at restaurants,
> > bars,
> >> or nightclubs
> >>
> >> * This proposal DOES NOT allow alcohol sales after 2am in
> >> supermarkets or
> >> liquor stores
> >>
> >> * This proposal applies ONLY to restaurants, bars or nightclubs in
> >> districts zoned for late night businesses.
> >>
> >> * This proposal DOES NOT override any local zoning controls.
> >>
> >> Here are the email addresses of our local elected
> >> officials:  <mailto:Aaron.Peskin@sfgov.org>Aaron.Peskin@sfgov.org;

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFLNC:  Support Later Last Call Hours

It's really easy...there are some of us thank drink responsibly that might
like to have cocktails AFTER 2am. I don't see what's so wrong about that. If
you think about it, if bars close later, people are less rushed to hammer
drinks before an early close time, at least that's the way *I* look at it.

> heya
>
> however much I disagree with laws in general, ones that are more pointed
to
> moderate a use of something rather than ban it all together actually
> sometimes make sense to some extent.
> I totally agree and support drug awareness/education. DanceSafe was one
> organization with one of the absolute best missions i've ever seen in the
> party world.
> But if you think about it, whats supposed to happen to limit the negative
> effects caused by people who aren't educated, soon to be educated, or
maybe
> never will be educated on the subject ? Like neither can ever fully
replace
> the other.
>
> What is the real gain from extending drinking hours ?
> More get drunk time ?
> More money for the clubs ?
> Really, if you think about it. If a club is still successfully open, and
has
> been for a long period of time. . . why are all of these people in support
> of giving some person MORE money ? If it was a lil club that was barely
> making it. . .is extending the drinking hours in that establishment going
to
> massively increase it's customer base, or it's income ?
> You would think it's more money for the community. . . but it's more money
> for the club, and less for the surrounding income based groups/orgs.
> What good does it do for the community as a whole ?
>
> it doesn't make sense to me. . .basically it's a business and not a govmt
> related idea. It wasn't designed for your average corner store, but just
> restaraunts and clubs (basically), so in reality it's only helping
increase
> the income of "some" community businesses. Why sell liquor after 2 or
> whatever, where someone could walk immediately out from a drink and drive
> away. . .when the store across the street can't, even tho the person would
> face a more serious violation (open container + this etc) and (unless they
> drank it on the way to their car) would not be drunk, alcohol can't be
> sitting next to you, etc (not to mention the amount of minors in clubs who
> drink, vs the difficulty buying from a store)?
> If I was a storekeeper I'd feel it was very unfair.
>
> It's not increasing any individuals freedom or right to do as they like
with
> their body. It's about regulating businesses to be responsible, and limit
> the negative effects of a business on the surrounding community
(considering
> the mass amount of people frequenting). A small company can do a huge
amount
> of damage or a huge amount of good for a community. But regardless the
> business should act upon a basic set of standards in place to protect the
> surrounding area and more.
>
> yes people should be responsible for themselves. . . of course. But even
the
> most responsible person has been irresponsible before, everybody has. But
> this isn't an initiative pushing the education of drinking on the clubs
> (which would make hell of a lot more sense than MORE drinking). . . it's
an
> initiative extending the supporting for drinking itself, not the
education,
> not the safer use of, but something to let people do as always, but for
> longer. Which btw makes club and establishment owners who already make
> money, make MORE money.
>
> Supporting the clubs is all well and good. But if anything. . . why isn't
> there an initiative on clubs by the SFLNC or someone that people support,
> that requires some sort of education materials and services (including
> required knowledge or testing for personnel handling/working with such
> materials) by businesses dealing with those products ?
> How many clubs have first aid kits ? Or trained cpr techs or anything near
> that on hand ?
> How many clubs or restaraunts do you know of that have any materials
> promoting the safe use of alcohol, and not the "drink me" type ads ? (btw
I
> know these things have been tried, but not backed as much and afterwards
> failed)
>
> If I was a teacher. . .I'd give the kids instructions on how to use the
> sharp object safely before I extended their playtime with it. . .
>
> Community support organizations need to lay their own path, they need to

risk

> > >> largest Cities.  This will give San Franciscans and visitors to our
> > >> City
> > >> similar rights to those enjoyed in New York, Chicago, Miami, New
> > >> Orleans
> > >> and other large cities that allow alcohol sales after 2am.  This will

-----Original Message-----
From: aK [mailto:aK@hard-grooves.com]
Sent: Tuesday, February 03, 2004 7:16 PM
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org; Apollo
Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFLNC: Support Later Last Call Hours


heya

hmmm. . . not that I don't support the SFLNC. . . most people know I do. =
. .

but one of the last things I'd ever support would be anything regarding
alcohol, or something that lets people drink MORE.

I think (or would guess) that the reason there is a "last call" for =
alcohol,
and restrictions on selling alcohol after certain hours, would be for =
the
safety of the public.
Realistically, these limitations are a somewhat sensible time to have =
people
stop drinking. More than likely tho, even with those times, people still =
end
up driving home under the influence and are much much much more likely =
to
hurt or kill any random innocent person on their obviously compromised =
drive
home.

with the amount of drunken driving these days. . . the last thing anyone
really needs is to increase the likelihood of drunken accidents.
I understand it may help the entertainment scene in SF. I just think =
it's
just plain stupid to trade the potential lives of people for clubs to =
make
more money.

shit, everyone knows that one of the worst times to leave a party, is =
right
when everone else is. With people drunk or on whatever, and the mass of =
them
trying to go wherever at the same time, it can be a kind of dangerous =
chaos
at times. No wonder every time I would go to a club or party, someone =
ALWAYS
hit my car. . .

I would hope that this attempt from the SFLNC isn't fueled by =
"donations"
from people who would no doubt benefit from the passing of something =
like
this. Too many people these days "sell out" for money. Not enuf people =
these
days give a shit about the people they hurt doing it.

I'm not a drinker, I hate alcohol. I've seen and been in cars with
inebriated drivers and thankfully survived those experiences of going =
off
the road, etc. I see people do horrible and stupid things due to alcohol
moreso than any drug I've ever known of.

Its similar to how the US covers up issues with things like tainted =
meat,
etc. Because they gain financially from the distribution of it. It's all =
a
very saddening thought.

No matter what anyone says, the people involved supporting issues that =
lead
to the destruction of lives and health of others are majorely the ones =
with
the "bloody hands". Thats not saying that I don't support peoples =
freedom to
decide for themselves. But bars and clubs are the "pushers" of one of =
the
most dangerous chemicals used every day. And it's legal, despite the =
damage
it does. Why ? Cuz it makes them money. . .

I think it's a badd idea, and if I lived in SF I would write to my =
district
supervisor in support AGAINST it. Other than that tho, I'm all for
supporting clubs in ANY OTHER WAY (of which are many).

aK

> WHAT:  1. Write an email in support of extending last call hours for

>               2. Come to the hearing at the Board of Supervisors

<http://sfgov.org/site/bdsupvrs_page.asp?id=3D13954>http://sfgov.org/site=

pvrs_page.asp?id=3D13954
