Details:

Introducing the World's First Digital Mixer for DJ's Digital mixing
offers
incredible audio fidelity, inherent reliability and noise-free fading.
With its modular construction, the RED Sound INFADER allows the user to
choose from a number of crossfading options including the patented
Tri-Fader. This convention-shattering device allows DJ's to crossfade by
selectable bands of frequencies. And with many more modules in the
pipeline, InFader is sure to become a dance classic.

Overview The main mixer section features 2 x input channels with 3 band
EQ
(+4/-85dB) and selectable balanced microphone/line level input section
with 2 band EQ. The 'multi-tap' effects send/return loop lets you choose
exactly where to pick-off and return the signal for effects processing
and
also doubles-up as an auxiliary stereo line level input for expanded
input
capability. With balanced master outputs, crossfader curve control and a
comprehensive monitoring section, INFADER delivers professional mixing
performance at an affordable price. All high usage faders and knobs are
microprocessor controlled assuring extra long life for major hardware
components.

Tri-Fader Module Patent Pending By expanding the traditional single
crossfader section to incorporate 3 crossfaders, each with it's own
high-order digital filter, crossfades can now be broken-down precisely
into low, mid and high frequency bands for stunning crossfade mixing.
For
example, the lows from one track can be mixed with the mids and/or highs
from another. Additional features include 3-way/single crossfader
select,
reverse function and crossfader 'centre-off' option.

Forthcoming modules for INFADER will include: BPM Module - single
crossfader, V2 BPM engine with 2 x BPM readouts, audio/MIDI sync

BPM Sync Module - single crossfader, 2 channel beat matching, basic
punch-in FX

BPM Auto-Sync Module - single crossfader, 2 channel CD/Vinyl deck speed
control system for automatic BPM lock

BPM FX Module - single crossfader, Multi BPM effects with 2 x BPM
readouts

Filter Module - details TBA

--

"A human being is part of a whole, called by us the "Universe," a part
limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and
feelings, as something separated from the rest--a kind of optical delusion
of his consciousness... Our task must be to free ourselves from this
prison by widening our circles of compassion to embrace all living
creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -Albert Einstein

and a tragedy.

ty, rat bastard on the side of the pinata entitled, well, "Dirty Rat Bastar=
ds!" If, on the other hand, you're one of those, smarmy, self-satisfied hal=

n Francisco playspace known as the Citadel!  -Father Dan Welle Nosebest -  =
PS.Tonight, the SIN!ema will be showing cautionary tales of Wrath gone just=
 a little too far: Anger Management, The Hulk, and Serial Mom.

Are you suffering from ROMANCESTIPATION?
SIN! salutes the cardinal sin of Wrath on Valentine's Day Eve

Date: Friday, February 13, 2004
Time: 9 p.m. to 2:30 a.m.
Frequency: Second Friday of every month
Location: The Rawhide
280 Seventh St. at Folsom St.
San Francisco

Info/Media Line: 415-626-4561
Age limit: 21 & over, ID required.
Price: $5 dressed before 10 p.m., $10 dressed after, $15 drab (all night)
Dress code and special promotional discounts online.

Been rejected lately? Can't get on with life because you're still blocked u=
p from your last relationship? Still smarting over that goodbye note scrawl=
ed on a Post-It? Sick and tired of hearing about your ex's perfect new girl=
friend with her perfect job and her Perfect Hair And HER PERFECT, um, well,=
 you get the idea. What you are suffering from is what we here at the First=
 Church of the Second Friday call "romancestipation." In order to have any =
chance of nooky in the Year of the Monkey, you must clear this blockage bef=
ore Valentine's Day, and we have just the Sin to help you do it!
Through years of study and meditation and, well frankly, more than a few re=
ally bad breakups and wasted years spent mooning over what could have been =
if they hadn't left us when we needed them most and, um NEVERMIND! Where we=
re we? Oh yes, through years of intensive study at the school of hard knock=
s, we have determined that the Sin most useful for clearing your karma befo=
re entering the romantic new year is the Sin of WRATH. Yes, there's nothing=
 like the cleansing fire that is ANGER to clean out the pipes of any left o=
ver rejection refuse and bad breakup bilge.
So how do you express this Wrath toward that special someone who really des=
erves it without the requisite stint of hard time in your local penitentiar=
y? By looking fabulous and beating the cr*p out of them ? IN EFFIGY! That's=
 right, effigy! We have procured Hers and His pi?atas that we have stuffed =
with the accoutrement of cheap and meaningless (but safe!) sex! Come on dow=
n to SIN! on Friday the 13th in your sexiest outfit and scrawl the loser's =
name or tape a special memento on the outside of the appropriate pi?ata and=
, at midnight, queue up to take a symbolic whack with the First Church's ow=
n Louisville Slugger. Do it, and as the pi?ata cracks and single-use latex =
goods come raining down, you'll feel the bitterness just drain away ? SIN! =
- where letting go feels a lot like getting even!

Reclaim The Streets!

=A0 =A0

Posts: 3

Re: Reclaim The Streets Party (FREE)
=AB Reply #1 on: Today at 3:27pm =BB=09 Quote  Modify  Remove
------------------------------------------------------------------------
This Reclaim The Streets event is being used in part to help bring together=
 the SF "activist" community, with the underground artist/performer communi=
ty, and the late night dance/music communities. =A0We all experience first =
hand the increasing intrusiveness of state repression. =A0Art, performance,=
 music, dance, these are the things that celebrate life and should be held =
up and revered in our society. Instead however, it is these very things tha=
t are constantly trying to be squashed. =A0If you want to have an art exhib=
ition, a performance, a concert, or a party, you have to jump through all s=
orts of bureaucratic hoops, pay for all sorts of permits, and then IF they =
approve of things, you are allowed to have your event. What happens if you =
don't have the means to meet all of their ridiculous standards? What if you=
 don't have the money to pay for all of their permits? Your options include=
 not having the event at all, or having it anyway illegally. And so we have=
 these unpermitted events. Often. And almost as often we have them shut dow=
n by the police. Or they just come in and harass people. For what? For enjo=
ying life? For celebrating that which makes us human? But we're experiencin=
g it more and more. And now they have the RAVE act at their disposal too. A=
nd it is going to continue to get worse until we rise up and say "Enough!"
=A0
So that is part of what we're doing with this RTS. Showing that if you
won't let us have our events in our own spaces where we aren't bothering an=
yone, than we are going to take it to the streets and have our events there=
!
=A0
For more info about RTS itself, you should go straight to the source. These=
 two links are from the London RTS group which began RTS originally way bac=
k in the day. They're a bit long, but very worth reading.
http://rts.gn.apc.org/evol.htm
and
http://rts.gn.apc.org/prop01.htm
=A0
See You There!
http://www.rts-sf.org (still working on this)

Saturday, February 21, 2004 ** ***Mirage*** presented by Illumination Recor=
ds, Hardscience, and friends **

As many of you may know already, Mirage first appeared as a Wednesday club =
night here in San Jose. Unfortunately, as with many nightclubs in the scene=
, the venue was sold and new owners came in to change the club into a blues=
-rock bar. Mirage with its family and friends enjoyed a fun 2003 run and th=
e night vanished just before winter. Recently, we were told that Mirage wil=
l once again take shape in February. All who were involved with Mirage will=
 return to help recreate the magic and build a safe-haven for its reappeara=
nce. As the prophets give us more information, we will forward the details =
to you. Returning to the source of power are Mirage resident DJs: Michael L=
iu (Illumination Records), Denise (Sound Asylum), Dragn'fly (Shaolin), Maje=
re (Elektrosorcery), and Proteus (Vibe Rite). Crisp clean concert sound pow=
ered by Logik Pro. Much more information to follow on this all ages event..=
=2E If you wish to help direct your positive energies to the rematerializat=
ion of Mirage, please get in touch.

Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] some remixes added to my CD  (bsp again)

I'm adding some "DJ remixes" to fill up space since
there were only 6 hip-hop tracks on the new CD. 
"She's Crafty" and "Wild Thing" are new.  

I also re-did "For What It's Worth" hella violenter, 
with in-yo-face 9/11 sass-back.  I figure we no longer
need to baby ourselves from the shock, and start
reflecting critically.  Now  with more guns and bombs
and people screaming!  I'm sure David Crosby would be
pleased.

Some of the remixes are rudimentary, recorded when I
was just learning the ropes, so please don't get all
sad & pouty that I haven't added complex 303 
basslines to Peter Gabriel.  The AndyW remix for
example, could barely even be called a remix, but it
took me 12 hours to do.  OK, I was on acid at the
time.

Send me your snail addy if any of these songs pique
your interest more than my hippie-house honky-hop, and
I will mail you a CD.  Track listing below.

And if you want, you can send me some of your own
beats for me to fuck around with.   All this music is
stolen, so it'd be nice to have original breakbeats or
hip-hop instrumentals.  I won't use your beats for
profit without negotiation first.

-peter

8. Fila Brazilla - Harmonicas Are Shite (What Freaks
Do remix)

9. Peter Gabriel - Of These, Hope (Future remix)

10. Beastie Boys – Transitions (Humanity remix)

11. AndyW – Solitude (Unauthorized remix)

12. Buffalo Springfield - For What It’s Worth
(Aeroplane in the Sky remix)	

13. The Doors - Peace Frog (Ghost remix) 

14. Beastie Boys - She’s Crafty	  (Pencildick remix)

15. Ton Loc – Wild Thing	  (XXX remix)

--=20
What this says to me is that too many whites are getting away with drug
use, too many whites are getting away with drug sales, too many whites
are getting away with trafficking in this stuff. The answer to this
disparity is not to start letting people out of jail because we're not
putting others in jail who are breaking the law. The answer is to go out
and find the ones who are getting away with it, convict them and send
them up the river, too."

- Rush Limbaugh. October 5, 1995 show transcript.

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Subject: [sfraves] Thursday night review: Uplift

OK... so like Thursday night was fuckin' Awesome man!  I seriously had a Groovy night...Gosh... OK... so like I had class 'til like 9:45-10 & didn't get 2 Sublounge 'til later than i usually got there on Uplift nights... so i caught a good portion of Jack Triumph's Proggy House set... mmmmmm... Yummy!  He even threw in a Proggy Breakbeats track just 4 me like he told me he was gonna do earlier Thursday...

Oh Yeah... upstairs was all about Proggy House & alota Vocal House also I knew all the DJs up there... but like can't remember like who they were w/o the bsp...

Anyway, Forest went on next & well... due 2 technical difficulties, only like 1/2 her set was well, done.. I mean... it was a split set literally...she started out playin like these Heavy Percussion Salsa Techno tracks that were totally fun, shit happened w/ equiuptment, then she jus played a techno set after the drama but played some Awesome tracks in between all her split set... does that make like sense?

OK... then like Ethan went on next & fuck man... his set went fuckin' everywhere, he played some house, he played some techno, but oph my fuckin' goodness man... HE PLAYED SOME ACID!!!  LoL.. as soon as he walked in Sublounge & we both like greeted each other & small talk, how U been, la la la... I asked him if he brought any acid & he told me that from the looks of the crowd, they really wouldn't be ready 4 it, but he had some acid he brought if he saw fit 2 spin them... so yeah... Hello 2Day, anywaze, I'm like dancing 'cause fuck man... Ethan set was well... a much needed dance floor "I had a semi shitty week so i'm gonna dance my ass off" thingie... not 2 say that i wasn't groovin during the other sets & diggin' them... but oooh man.. 

So anywaze, Ethan busted out with Acid Break Beats towards the end of his set & jus about then, I was in Hevean!  I mean... good fuckin' Shit... yeah... totally Awesome man 'cause I was jus totally feelin' it!  LoL... I <3ed it so much.. Thanks Ethan!

Oh Gosh... then Calamity Jane went on next & ofcourse her set was fuckin' Bad Ass as usual... mmmmmmmm... Breakbeats!!!  Wow.. i jus realized i been talkin' alot about breakbeats in the post... lol... Love 'em!

OK.. but @ the same time... JC was upstair spinnin this like Multi Genre enduced House set & yummy, he dropped hella vocal house as well... OH yeah... & it was totally fun 2 like dance 2 while i was playin Tekkan... anywaze.... ok... he fuckin' dropped like this old school Techno track in the middle of his set & man... it was fuckin' well... i was dancing then slowly realized that my dance steps changed & were totally moving hella differently...  Hello 2day.. Loved it!!!

As 4 people there... it was your usual kinda mixed vibe, mixed people, but all groovers!  Not alota family was there, but it was Awesome seein' like SirNod pop up all outta the blue since he like rarely goes out these nights... LoL... yeah... i got this funny story of a picture  of my & Sirnod's big ass pudgy hands giving me a CD while i'm rollin' while workin' a coat chack shift @ a party a loooooong time ago... wait.. i think i jus told the story,,, oh... i gotta shouw y'all the pix.. 

but yeah... it was a nice crowd & saw alota people & more importantly, i got a ride home 2 Hercules!!!  It was Dope... i been emailing w/ this Dude like well... a week & a 1/2 prior... & although he lives like totally opposite from East Bay... he said he'd bring me home if i made it Sub Lounge... this Dude btw, Ewan, bad ass fuckin' Proogy/ Tech house DJ!

OK... well.... i manage 2 write more on here than the paper i'm suppose 2 b working on right now 4 school... lol.. so i think i better get off my study break... it's jus' i been meaning 2 write about uplift & finally had the time 2 do it now... lol

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

--

dance music and I would very much appreciate it if some of you could help me
out.  If you just have a moment in your day when you're not doing anything,
I would absolutely love it if you could just take the time...I have no money
to do formal interviews at this time but i'm looking into funding...

Ok, so...What I need:  write down all the genres of electronic dance music
you can think of and then write down the best descriptions you can come up
with for each genre.  I don't expect anything as extensive as ishkur's
guide, but a few sentences per genre would help me out greatly.  If you
don't have time to describe all the genres you can think of, just jot down
the names and describe the "main" ones (whatever that means to you).

Thanks SOOOOO much.

*emma*

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Comcast, issue ads and free speech

An especially interesting case involves the Marijuana Policy Project, a
D.C.-based advocacy group engaged in a little-noticed legal struggle
that could have far-ranging implications. The group wants presidential
candidates to firm up their positions on the medically-accepted value of
marijuana in treating certain serious illnesses (cultivation and
possession is currently allowed in eight states with physician's
approval but totally forbidden by federal statute.) MPP planned to place
about $10,000 worth of issue ads in New Hampshire in anticipation of
that state's primary. But when their local rep contacted
ComCast -- America's largest cable company -- for a rate card, they
were told that the corporate legal department would not make one
available to the organization. This was based not on the ad content
-- the company hadn't even seen that yet -- only on the name of the
sponsoring organization.

Coverage:
http://tompaine.com/feature2.cfm/ID/9746

Subject: [sfraves] (NRR) New So. Cal Barbies...

--0-472299511-1076964295=:39105
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii


Mattel recently announced the release of
Limited-Edition So-Cal dolls for the Southern
California market: 

Irvine Barbie: 
This princess Barbie is only sold at The Irvine
Spectrum. She comes with an assortment of Kate Spade
handbags, a Lexus SUV, a long-haired foreign dog named
Honey, and a cookie-cutter house. Available with or
without tummy tuck and facelift. Workaholic Ken sold
only in conjunction with "augmented" version.

Tustin Barbie: 
This modern-day homemaker Barbie is available with
Ford Windstar minivan and matching gym outfit. She
gets lost easily and has no full time occupation or
secondary education. Traffic-jamming cell phone sold
separately. 

Van Nuys Barbie: 
This recently paroled former "Porn Actress" Barbie
comes with a 9mm handgun, a Ray Lewis knife, a Chevy
with dark tinted windows, and a meth lab kit. This
model is only available after dark and can only be
paid for in cash. Preferably small, untraceable bills
... unless you are a cop, then we don't know what you
are talking about.

Santa Monica Barbie:
This yuppie Barbie comes with your choice of BMW
convertible or Hummer H2. Included are her own
Starbucks cup, credit card, and country club
membership. Also available for this set are Shallow
Ken and Private School Skipper. You won't be able to
afford any of them.

Fontana Barbie: 
This pale model comes dressed in her own Wrangler
jeans two sizes too small, a NASCAR shirt, and Tweety
Bird tattoo on her shoulder. She has a six-pack of
Coors Light and a Hank Williams, Jr. CD set. She can
spit over 5 feet and kick mullet-haired Ken's ass when
she is drunk. Purchase her pickup truck separately and
get a confederate flag bumper sticker absolutely free.

Newport Beach Barbie:
This collagen injected, rhinoplastic Barbie wears a
leopard print bikini outfit and drinks cosmopolitans
while entertaining friends at the beach house.
Percocet prescription available.

Riverside Barbie: 
This tobacco chewing, brassy-haired Barbie has a pair
of her own high-heeled sandals with one broken heel
from the time she chased Beer-Gut Ken out of Fontana
Barbie's house. Her ensemble includes low-rise
acid-washed jeans, fake fingernails, and a see-through
halter top. Also available with a mobile home.

Laguna Beach Barbie:
This doll is made of actual tofu. She has long
straight brown hair, archless feet, hairy armpits, no
makeup, and Birkenstocks with white socks. She prefers
that you call her "Willow". She does not want or need
a Ken doll, but you if purchase two Laguna Beach
Barbie's and the optional Subaru wagon, you get a
rainbow flag sticker for free.

Long Beach Barbie: 
This Barbie now comes with a stroller and infant doll.
Optional accessories include a GED and bus pass.
Gangsta Ken and his '79 Caddy were available, but are
now very difficult to find since the addition of the
infant.

Rancho Santa Margarita Barbie:
She's perfect in every way. We don't know who Ken is
because he's always away hunting.

City of Industry Barbie:
This Spanish-speaking-only Barbie comes with a 1984
Toyota with expired temporary plates and three baby
Barbies in the back seat, but no car seats. The
optional Ken doll comes with a meat-packer's uniform
and is missing three fingers on his left hand. Green
cards are not available for City of Industry Barbie or
Ken.

West Hollywood Barbie/Ken:
This versatile doll can be easily converted from
Barbie to Ken by simply adding or subtracting the
multiple "snap-on" parts.

Subject: [sfraves] SFLNC:  LEGISLATION TO ALLOW 18+ AFTERHOURS 

--=====================_26283093==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


LEGISLATION TO ALLOW 18+ AFTERHOURS

I'd like to inform everyone about another exciting legislative development 
intended to bring the fun back to San Francisco's entertainment 
scene.  Supervisor Bevan Dufty and the San Francisco Youth Commission have 
teamed up to introduce legislation that would allow 18+ Venues to apply to 
the Entertainment Commission for an after hours permit.  This legislation 
will be heard at a special session of the City Services Committee of the 
Board of Supervisors on Thursday, Feb. 19th at 5 pm in Rm. 263 of City Hall.
Some of you may remember that this legislation was up a year ago, sponsored 
by the SFLNC and (then) Supervisor Mark Leno.  Unfortunately, it was vetoed 
by Mayor Brown and the Supervisors could not overturn his veto.  It is a 
sad fact that the City of San Francisco will send our young adults to war 
but will not allow us to stay out dancing after 2am.  In contrast, most 
major US Cities allow 18+ afterhours events and some, such as Los Angeles, 
even allow all age events to go all night.

Supervisor Dufty's Ordinance would simply allow Places of Entertainment that:
(1) are "bona fide public eating places" (which have a Type 47 liquor 
license that allows 18+) or
(2) do not have a liquor license
to apply to the Entertainment Commission for an after hours permit.

We need a strong turnout at the hearing to help carry this bill into 
reality.  We have a new Mayor and a fresh chance to give our youth the 
right to dance all night!  As a 20 year old, it is not a moment to soon.

Check out 
<http://sflnc.com/index/readthis/news/youth_crisis/>http://sflnc.com/index/readthis/news/youth_crisis/ 
for the text of the Ordinance, a resolution from the Youth Commission 
declaring a "public health" crisis for Youth in San Francisco, for media 
articles on the 18+ legislation and more...

Spread the word!
Liam Shy
Media and Public Relations Officer, SF Youth Commission
Youth Action Coordinator, SFLNC
<mailto:liamshy@sflnc.com>liamshy@sflnc.com



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                 http://mokshatribe.org/photos/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Fascism should more properly be called corporatism because it is the 
merger of state and corporate power."
-Benito Mussolini

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Psychedelic Pioneer Humphry Osmond Dies

--=====================_46599816==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed



Psychedelic Pioneer Humphry Osmond Dies
http://www.erowid.org/culture/characters/osmond_humphry/

British psychiatrist and psychedelic researcher Humphry Osmond died on
Feb 6, 2004 at the age of 86.  Osmond worked with mescaline and LSD in
the 50s and 60s, primarily seeking treatment possibilities for
alcoholism and schizophrenia.  He is best known for coining the term
"psychedelic" in a letter to Aldous Huxley in 1956.



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                 http://mokshatribe.org/photos/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Fascism should more properly be called corporatism because it is the 
merger of state and corporate power."
-Benito Mussolini

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

-----Original Message-----
From: J.C. [mailto:dougm@kzsu.stanford.edu]
Sent: Monday, February 16, 2004 12:42 AM
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Comcast, issue ads and free speech


An especially interesting case involves the Marijuana Policy Project, a
D.C.-based advocacy group engaged in a little-noticed legal struggle
that could have far-ranging implications. The group wants presidential
candidates to firm up their positions on the medically-accepted value of
marijuana in treating certain serious illnesses (cultivation and
possession is currently allowed in eight states with physician's
approval but totally forbidden by federal statute.) MPP planned to place
about $10,000 worth of issue ads in New Hampshire in anticipation of
that state's primary. But when their local rep contacted
ComCast -- America's largest cable company -- for a rate card, they
were told that the corporate legal department would not make one
available to the organization. This was based not on the ad content
-- the company hadn't even seen that yet -- only on the name of the
sponsoring organization.

Coverage:
http://tompaine.com/feature2.cfm/ID/9746

--=20

After enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water."

KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Subject: [sfraves] SOMA Sessions : Fri 2/27 : NOOKIE (Good Looking - UK), Ultraviolet

SOMA Sessions
Drum & Bass Fourth Fridays @ AsiaSF
San Francisco, USA

Friday February 27, 2004

NOOKIE (Good Looking - UK)
With countless releases on Reinforced, Moving Shadow,
Labello Blanco and most recently, LTJ Bukem's Good
Looking Records, Nookie's style and artistic vision
have pushed the boundaries of Drum & Bass leaving
countless classics in his wake.  His highly
sought-after talents as a producer, engineer, remixer
and DJ have taken him around the world many times. 
SOMA Sessions is excited and honored to host this
seminal artist for an evening of amazing music.

ULTRAVIOLET (Sleeveless, SF Agency)
UltraViolet is known to level dance floors with her
wide range of styles and fierce skills. This founding
member of the notorious Sleeveless collective is not
to be missed!

Resident support:
DJ M
SOUND:BOY

Discount presale tickets available now via PayPal at
http://www.somasessions.com

Hours: 10:30pm - 3am
Entry: 21+ with photo ID
Tickets: $11 presale, $15 door
Bar: $3 drink specials all night!

AsiaSF
201 9th St at Howard St
San Francisco, CA 94103
AsiaSF serves 3-Star Cal-Asian cuisine in a festive
and stylish atmosphere.  For Sunday-Thursday dinner
reservations, call 415.255.ASIA(2742) between the
hours of 1pm and 8pm.

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 18 Feb 2004 00:08:37.0445 (UTC) FILETIME=[5B31D750:01C3F5B3]

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Looking for past event flyers

Vestax is all over Ebay and no from distributors. It is probably illegal
to use their logos or claim to be a distributor. If you are selling a
Vestax product you have the right to tell people what you are selling.
If you use the name but are not selling the product just trying to get
people to look at your auctions then I could see them getting a bit
pissed. 

On the note of flyers I used to have a huge box of flyers from 92-95
from the bay area but my ex-girlfriend has probably long since burned
them. 

Jason

In a message dated 2/17/2004 4:17:12 PM Pacific Standard Time, DJBigDaddyG 
writes:
your very true and you are on the dot with that. it would be highly illega to 
use someones logo if you do not get aproval from the people in witch you 
would like to use there logo's for. also the same on flyers. say if i wanted 
people to come to my event and i put dj dragn'flys logo on my flyer she could sue 
the shit out of me for that... witch i would never do dina i love you :-) 

-warren 

In a message dated 2/17/2004 4:08:53 PM Pacific Standard Time, 
djjasonphilips@hotmail.com writes:
Vestax is all over Ebay and no from distributors. It is probably illegal
to use their logos or claim to be a distributor. If you are selling a
Vestax product you have the right to tell people what you are selling.
If you use the name but are not selling the product just trying to get
people to look at your auctions then I could see them getting a bit
pissed. 

On the note of flyers I used to have a huge box of flyers from 92-95
from the bay area but my ex-girlfriend has probably long since burned
them. 

Jason

your very true and you are on the dot with that. it would be highly illega to 
use someones logo if you do not get aproval from the people in witch you 
would like to use there logo's for. also the same on flyers. say if i wanted 
people to come to my event and i put dj dragn'flys logo on my flyer she could sue 
the shit out of me for that... witch i would never do dina i love you :-) 

-warren 

In a message dated 2/17/2004 4:08:53 PM Pacific Standard Time, 
djjasonphilips@hotmail.com writes:
Vestax is all over Ebay and no from distributors. It is probably illegal
to use their logos or claim to be a distributor. If you are selling a
Vestax product you have the right to tell people what you are selling.
If you use the name but are not selling the product just trying to get
people to look at your auctions then I could see them getting a bit
pissed. 

On the note of flyers I used to have a huge box of flyers from 92-95
from the bay area but my ex-girlfriend has probably long since burned
them. 

Jason

dude

ok, I wrote a bunch on this but deleted it.

simply, there aren't words in any language to correctly decipher what goes
on in ones minds eye.
It's easily misinterpreted, and miscommunicated.

don't worry about anything.

keep yourself open to see for yourself.

psychics can see things, but they can't truly convey their visions perfectly
to non-seers.
and there are consequences for a persons misuse of energies.

all in all, don't listen to psychics who exploit their "visions" on tv and
radio shows. their visions will typically be tainted in ways. not everyone
is meant to know certain things, or many things.


uuuh, yeah.

well theres hell of a lot more too it, but its one of those things that if I
had to teach it to everyone, they weren't really supposed to know it
anyways. It's like one of those catch 22 things.

now this is pretty cool news to hear. . .

aparrently 2600 gay couples have been married in SF in the past couple =
weeks despite CA state law disapproving same sex marriages. Like 170 =
recieved licenses yesterday. There was a line outside city hall 2 hours =
before they opened today.
I think theres another court hearing on the subject scheduled for march =
29th.

I love this. It's awesome to finally see a mayor that defies the state =
law for something they believe in. Even mr terminator is opposed to gay =
marriages (or so he says).

SF is issuing marriage licenses to gay couples until courts formally =
tell them the must stop.

A lady (obviously a closet dyke, and opposing) on the news brought up =
the issues about all sorts of lawsuits that may be a result of this. My =
question is, who's going to sue who ? Who did any wrong to anyone else ? =
Marriage as a whole should be supported, to whoever it is, as long as =
it's between people who love eachother. Thats what our kids should =
learn, and thats whats important.

It pissed me off to see all the local homes around here posting their =
signs to vote against the gay marriage rights of couples. And I think =
the whole voting deal was somewhat biased since some of the only places =
around here offering voting thingies (whatever the hell theyre called) =
were in churches.  Every house that I knew had assholes living in em had =
these signs showing their closed-mindedness, the drunk ones that'd yell =
at me when I drove by, all the mormons that are everywhere around here, =
the old mean people. . .

Personally I hate how christians (mainly) are trying to twist the govmt =
around to favor their own freedom and not the freedom of EVERYONE. Like =
the 10 commandment issue. How many groups are trying to keep the 10 =
commandments out of public schools, and religious shows saying that =
without the commandments, that the kids will learn to cheat, and steal, =
and kill, and commit adultery. Christians are some of the biggest =
murderers of all time, kings have changed the bible to suit their own =
wants, they literally stole lives and land from all sorts of people for =
any reason they wanted to.Seriously, practically all people who =
routinely are known for cheating on their husbands/wives are christian =
or catholic or whatever. Kids aren't going to start killing people just =
cuz these so called rules aren't there. It's basic belief that killing =
people is bad, that cheating on loved ones is badd. . .=20

I'm so so happy to see that these huge organizations are not getting =
their way. It's about friggin time.

there just might be hope for the world yet !

: )

aK

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 18 Feb 2004 18:18:05.0915 (UTC) FILETIME=[8DD6CAB0:01C3F64B]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] GO GO Gavin, gay marriages

You got off on a tangent there a bit Aryck, but as to the *who did any wrong
to anyone else* part...

Really this comes down to legalities in extending benefits to same sex
partners.

Suddenly businesses will have to extend the healthcare benfits they offer to
the same sex partner of their employee. That's more money out of pocket for
the businesses. That's the main financial problem I see a lot of people
pissed off over.

By having some form of government OK a same sex marriage suddenly
legitimizes same sex relations which scares the crap out of those scared of
change. Suddenly children are exposed to confusing family roles that aren't
inline with what they see in their hetero families. It's a direct challenge
to world religions that have been teaching people that gay is wrong for
thousands of years. It's a wrench in the works of what's become comfortable
and acceptable in our society. Change is coming...

Overall I think the *wrong doing* is merely the fear of change that's being
created. I fully support the marriages and think it's a great act of civil
disobedience. I whole heartedly hope that this paves a way for equal rights
to all citizens of this country to marry whom they choose. Well, maybe not
like your sister or your cousin, but you get what I mean. =)

I just wonder how long it will be before another government entity steps in
and stops the marriages in SF... I'm betting less than a week before we see
the GOP shit a brick and come running to shut it all down.

:: r ::

to

for
> the businesses. That's the main financial problem I see a lot of people
> pissed off over.
>

> legitimizes same sex relations which scares the crap out of those scared
of
> change. Suddenly children are exposed to confusing family roles that
aren't
> inline with what they see in their hetero families. It's a direct
challenge
> to world religions that have been teaching people that gay is wrong for
> thousands of years. It's a wrench in the works of what's become
comfortable
> and acceptable in our society. Change is coming...
>

being

> disobedience. I whole heartedly hope that this paves a way for equal
rights
> to all citizens of this country to marry whom they choose. Well, maybe not
> like your sister or your cousin, but you get what I mean. =)

in
> and stops the marriages in SF... I'm betting less than a week before we
see
> the GOP shit a brick and come running to shut it all down.

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] GO GO Gavin, gay marriages

yknow, I was thinking about that too, as far as the who if effects is
concerned.

But is there somehow more of an impact on insurance companies etc, than
there would be if the same person married the opposite sex ? Maybe males are
typically hurt or damaged than females, but wouldn't the ins companies make
up for their losses with the girl/girl relationships ? If that was the case.

I think it all comes down to that one nation under god thing. How marriage
is typically defined as a man and a woman. So really it's just a moral view
of the people in power thats influencing all of this and not really a
financial or economic matter. The fact that it's just merely a matter of
religious or moral opinion being forced upon a country of varying beliefs
and values, and the freedom it takes from such a growing population of
people is just wrong, and kinda rediculous actually.

I was really really suprised that that law actually ever passed. It's so
restricting of peoples opinion for unrealistic reason. I think the major
reason its in effect now and people have their political standpoints on the
issue is simply just for their own political benefit, cuz if the president
said he supported it he would be likely to lose millions of voters' support.
People "should" have the thoughts and morals leading to the greater good of
the world and not just strengthening the power behind their own beliefs.
That actually in a lot of ways is almost unrealistic due to the vast
majority of people who believe otherwise, but in no way is that the
ultimately positive approach to making the world a better place for the next
generations. Does that make sense ?

it's unfortunate that the world will keep going such a restrictive direction
unless millions of people toss away the beliefs they've been taught for
hundreds of years. It's almost a losing battle, but at least I feel that
it's a battle worth fighting and losing rather than not fighting at all.

still it gives a lil glimmer of hope. . .

aK

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] PRETEND DJS - Coachella 2004... have you seen this line up?!

Nothing on Brandon here, just a more general thought, but....

How many people think our scene is being ruined in part by people pretending
to be DJs?  It's so easy to buy decks and a mixer and play make believe vs.
buy a guitar and play make believe, but people out here think it's okay to
charge money for you to watch themselves and their friends play make
believe.

I've been to way too many pay events in the last year or so with DJs that
were so bad it made me cringe.  I go out less because of it, if I see a Bay
Area club or underground consisting of a bunch of names I haven't heard of,
I just assume that most of the lineup is going to suck balls, and I don't
go.  It seems like so many people out here book themselves or their friends
when they should really give some serious thought as to whether others are
going to enjoy hearing them play...

I dunno, maybe it's just me, I played every day for three years before I
played out for my first time, I really wanted to have pride in what I was
doing when people heard me for the first time.  All I know is I've heard
some great talent on this list and around the Bay, I've heard bunch of DJs
that bring it, but they are overrun by such a sea of mediocrity that it
dilutes things at an average party.

-Andrew

much pixel pushing *i can fuck with photoshop but illustrator scares me*
designers. Talk about pretending... the flood of *graphic designers* that
occured in the .com boom where anyone who claimed to be capable of design
was hired soon flooded the market in the .com fallout. The industry is still
recovering from all the fake asses out there... oh and now you have little
high school kids out there undercutting real designers by charging next to
nothing and providing horrible work. It kills me when I see people stroking
ego on these fucks that can't design and have no concept of why the work
they do really is remedial.

go out because a lot of the time the music and the skill of the DJ is so

Date: 18 Feb 2004 21:33:31 -0000

From: "Liam Shy" <liamshy@breakbeat.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Reply-To: liamshy@breakbeat.com
X-IP: 63.196.0.72
X-Mailer: Inbox Mailer (http://www.inbox.net)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Call for Action to Legalize 18+ Afterhours!

Please Forward Widely!

WHAT:  Call for Action!

WHY:  To allow 18+ entertainment events to go past 2 am in SF!

WHEN:  Thursday, February 19th, 5 pm

WHERE:  City Hall, Room 263

HOW: Come down and testify, just show up and cheer, or send an e-mail to our Supervisors and Mayor!


Hello,

My name is Liam Shy and I am the Media and Public Relations Officer for the San Francisco Youth Commission and the Youth Action Coordinator for the San Francisco Late Night Coalition.  As most of you know, current City law forces 18+ entertainment events in San Francisco to shut down at 2 am.  This outdated law is why parties like Skills must end at 2 a.m.

As a young DJ and lover of electronic dance music, it has been an outrage that San Francisco has not offered it's young adults a legal permit for all night dancing.  Los Angeles, Seattle, Portland, New York, Chicago, and many other cities allow their young adults the right to dance all night.  Yet here in San Francisco we are told to go home at 2!

The sad part is, this archaic law could have been changed last year, when similar legislation was passed by the Board of Supervisors but was successfully vetoed by former Mayor Willie Brown.

But..... Supervisor Bevan Dufty has recently introduced a new draft of the legislation, giving us another shot.  We have a new Mayor and a fresh chance to give our youth the right to dance all night!  As a 20 year old, it is not a moment to soon.

Supervisor Bevan Dufty has introduced a new draft of the legislation, giving us another shot.  We have a new Mayor and a fresh chance to give our youth the right to dance all night!  As a 20 year old, it is not a moment to soon. 

Please take 5 minutes to send an e-mail in support the San Francisco Youth Commission and our project to make our city more youth friendly.

Here are some points to emphasize in your email:

- In the subject line, include "Support 18+ Afterhours" or something similar

- 18 year olds can vote and go to war, yet cannot dance after 2 a.m. in San Francisco.  That's just not fair.

- Los Angeles, Seattle, Portland, and many other jurisdictions allow their 18+ events to go all night

- San Francisco youth have few entertainment options, passing this law will encourage local business to produce 18+ events.

- Permitted late night venues provide safe environments for young adults.

 
Please send the emails to: Aaron.Peskin@sfgov.org; Jake.McGoldrick@sfgov.org; Michela.Alioto-Pier@sfgov.org; Fiona.Ma@sfgov.org; Matt.Gonzalez@sfgov.org; Chris.Daly@sfgov.org; Tony.Hall@sfgov.org; Bevan.Dufty@sfgov.org; Tom.Ammiano@sfgov.org; Sophie.Maxwell@sfgov.org; Gerardo.Sandoval@sfgov.org; Gavin.Newsom@sfgov.org

This legislation was sponsored by the San Francisco Youth Commission and is strongly supported by the SFLNC.  Read more at http://sflnc.com/index/readthis/news/youth_crisis/

Spread the word!

Liam Shy
Media and Public Relations Officer, SF Youth Commission
Youth Action Coordinator, SFLNC
liamshy@yahoo.com


---------------------------------------------------------------------

> I just assume that most of the lineup is going to suck balls, and I don't
> go.  It seems like so many people out here book themselves or their friends
> when they should really give some serious thought as to whether others are
> going to enjoy hearing them play...
>
> I dunno, maybe it's just me, I played every day for three years before I
> played out for my first time, I really wanted to have pride in what I was
> doing when people heard me for the first time.  All I know is I've heard
> some great talent on this list and around the Bay, I've heard bunch of DJs
> that bring it, but they are overrun by such a sea of mediocrity that it
> dilutes things at an average party.

Definitely happens.  Was at an event Fri. night, and the DJ was posing
so fierce behind the decks, obviously really FEELING himself, while
trainwrecking left and right.  And I mean trainwrecking, not just
slightly off.  And it HURT!

>
> -Andrew
>

-- 
As a wise old buddha said:
"Before enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water.
After enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water."

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Mime-Version: 1.0

Content-Disposition: inline
In-Reply-To: <BAY99-DAV20f7kUAVch000168c4@hotmail.com>
User-Agent: Mutt/1.3.28i
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] PRETEND DJS - Coachella 2004... have you seen this line up?!

Maybe you could print up some fliers for this class at Berklee
college in Boston, and then hand one out when a DJ "needs help".

http://www.cnn.com/2004/EDUCATION/02/18/music.dj.class.ap/index.html

But more common than just plainly bad technical skill is:

- DJs that seem to play whatever they want, whether it makes people
  dance or not. I'm not talking about one bad night. They don't get
  it. I call them musical masturbators. I want to dance. Get it?

- Promoters not giving enough thought to whether a DJ and what they
  tend to play is appropriate for the crowd and time. I call these
  bad promoters. IT IS NOT EASY TO BE A GOOD PROMOTER. It takes a
  lot of connections, a lot of skill, and truly evil desire to make
  people shake their booties off.

I think some cronyism is okay... often it results in more enthused
DJs. And tribes like to be tribes. But I've seen it all too often
ruin an event for me. "It was pretty, but I really wanted to dance."

Sean

Andrew Phelan <vgsandrew@hotmail.com> said...
> Nothing on Brandon here, just a more general thought, but....
> 
> How many people think our scene is being ruined in part by people pretending
> to be DJs?  It's so easy to buy decks and a mixer and play make believe vs.
> buy a guitar and play make believe, but people out here think it's okay to
> charge money for you to watch themselves and their friends play make
> believe.

Message-ID: <BAY8-F713MOsvGhcISP0001b9e5@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 18 Feb 2004 21:52:01.0983 (UTC) FILETIME=[70BB54F0:01C3F669]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] PRETEND DJS - Coachella 2004... have you seen this line up?!

I dunno, I've seen dj's who had been spinning for only two months come out 
and blow peopel away, and I've also seen dj's who have been at it for 10 + 
years who suck complete ass. I think the problem is, there're just too many 
people that have no clue whether or not they suck because no one ever told 
them as much, or they have hookups that will just book them because they're 
owe them a favor or are friends or what have you. You can't really 
pigeonhole people by time behind the decks or lack thereof. I blame it more 
on the phenomena of too many people trying to ride the "dj as a rockstar" 
wave...people who have put no effort into it whatsoever (time or otherwise), 
and who want to just "be cool".

M-
*THWAP!*//Substructure//Mario Bros.
DC/MD/VA/CA
deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass
AIM:  OPKing138

Upcoming appearances:
2/27/04 PROGRESSION @ 26 Mix w/Jack Triumph, Macadio, Illiaster & Floorcraft

> > and blow peopel away,
> 
> Maybe they blew someone away? But there's no chance they were really any

I've seen people who have very little technical skill have
unbelievably good track selection skills. And vice-versa.

I think the very best DJs ever have one thing in common: An
absolute lust for wanting to make people dance. They're the ones
that make people scream, and that help make the parties that
become legend.

Sean

Subject: RE: [sfraves] PRETEND DJS



1998 - Kdvs 90.3 on Tek-Induced Euphoria... 

Of course this shouldn't stir pictures of the two fake mixing.

Rather, after making specific demands for high end equipment, the host
of the show called and asked if I would bring my own decks & mixer for
the guys (which I kindly loaned the station and drove 20 miles round
trip).  We set up, we test it all out - it's ready to go.  M&M show up -
and all they have on is a DAT player and a tape.  Don't ask me why... 

They played the DAT.

People called in during the interview session to congratulate them on
such a great set.

"Thank you"... Was repeated a lot.

I only wish they had said something akin to: "thanks, but that was a
recording of blah blah blah" or something...

It's a much funnier story after I've had a few beers...

; )

Subject: Re: [sfraves] PRETEND DJS

Philip.X.Diaz <st_indigo@earthlink.net> said...
> "There's no such thing as bad DJs, just not enough drugs"  - me

I know this is tongue-in-cheek, but for its literal meaning I must
disagree. Perhaps it may have been true once, for me, but now there
is *no* amount of drugs that will make a shitty DJ sound great. I
wonder how that's true for other peeps.

> you've gotta hear Dina's story about Mars & Mystere playing a DAT on a 
> radio show and then passing off as a live set...

Ooooooh I'm gonna have to ask her sometime. Ask Terrac about
concerts he's been to with fake DJing. He's got some good ones.
He really loved this one by Moby, because Moby didn't even pretend
to be spinning, was just jumping all over the place :).

Sean

I disagree...a good friend of mine that goes by the name of BAKE out on the 
East Coast was a total and complete natural. He was spinning on the level of 
someone who had been spinning (well) for at least a few years around 3 
months after he picked up spinning. He was being booked at big clubs around 
5 months after starting, and there was HUGE response to his skill. That is 
just one example that I can PERSONALLY reference....

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 18 Feb 2004 23:24:02.0955 (UTC) FILETIME=[4B7CCDB0:01C3F676]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] PRETEND DJS - Coachella 2004... have you seen this line up?!

See - what kills me is - so many people still take dj'ing WAY too seriously. 
I mean, as much as I LOVe to spin, and when I've spun a nice set, it makes 
me feel good, I know that I'm still doing nothing short of playing someone 
else's music sheerly for the love and to try and make people dance. Any DJ 
who ISN'T scratching and cutting and employing hardware, gear, whatever ON 
TOP OF dj'ing has no room to act like they're a pimp. Once you get past 
learning the basics of phrasing and beatmatching - any monkey can dj. It's 
not that damn hard. If you have decent track selection and any CLUE as to 
how to work a crowd - that's just the bonus on top.

I have played in both bands and as a DJ, and dj'ing (just mixing) is easy 
cheesey compared to say - playing a guitar.

I blame the notion that DJ'ing as a technical artform on the whole 
"superstar dj" problem. Too many idiots who feel that playing records is 
actually a job that SHOULD pay thousands of dollars per night. Fucking 
rubbish.

M-

> > Maybe they blew someone away? But there's no chance they were really any
> > good.
>
>I've seen people who have very little technical skill have
>unbelievably good track selection skills. And vice-versa.

>I think the very best DJs ever have one thing in common: An
>absolute lust for wanting to make people dance. They're the ones
>that make people scream, and that help make the parties that
>become legend.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] PRETEND DJS

Sean,

	Excellent point. I think a lot of times when people are talking about 
how good or bad a particular DJ (or DJs) are, they forget that there 
are at least two totally different skills involved. And as you said, 
someone may be good at one and not the other. Of course a certain 
amount of it will always be subjective, since people enjoy hearing 
different sounds. One person's series of awful trainwrecks may be 
another's cool, experimental, industrial set.

	Of course I would probably tend to argue that poorly blended tracks 
are objectively *not* good music, even if someone may occasionally 
enjoy listening to it, but I'm sure that someone would disagree with 
me. There are, after all, people who believe anything that anyone calls 
art is art, and that no art is any better than any other art.

Groove on,
							<<< Starchild >>>

Subject: Re: [sfraves] GO GO Gavin, gay marriages

I dunno.... I can't help bt be of two minds on this one....


On the one hand:

I do agree that marriage is a fundamental right that should not be 
denied to any human; and especially not based on their sexual 
orientation.  I'm not particularly ready to GET married, myself.  And 
when I find out how young some people ARE getting married, I'm like... 
"WTF...  you're still so young...  you have your whole lives ahead of 
you and you're settling down and going domestic NOW????"  Hell, I'm 
closer to 30 than 20, and I still think *I* am too young to be married! 
  But WTF.... I still think it should be EVERYONE's right to have that 
choice.

As a bonus, pretty much anything that pisses off the xtians, the 
republicans, and their ilk, gets two hearty thumbs up from me.  And 
this sure has a lot of them riled up.


But on the other hand:

It is perfectly obvious to me that this is nothing more than a public 
relations ploy by "da mayor", as part of an effort to fool the gullible 
into beliving that he is not the right-wing ogre that he is.  He may 
masquerade as a liberal by claiming to be a democrat.  But he's 
certianly *NOT* left-of-center.  To see the REAL progressives in the 
mayors race, look to those who ran againse newson.  Look to Tom Ammiano 
and Matt Gonzalez.

Basiclly, we have willie brown Mk. 2...  another mayor who pretends to 
be liberal in order to get votes, but is really well to the right of 
the opposition.  The only difference seems to be that while brown was 
open in his corruption and pandering to the conservative intrests in 
SF, and indeed, he seemed to revel in it; gavin newsom is aparantly 
employing some PR people, and throwing the city's progressives a bone.

And make no mistake.  This is just a zero-risk publicity stunt on the 
part of newsom.  He KNOWS how close he came to losing the election to a 
REAL liberal.  He KNOWS that the progressives smell the blood in the 
water, and will be going for his throat; and might just cut it, in the 
next election.  This gay-marriage stunt is an easy way for him to 
appear to be the liberal choice, without having to actually take a 
stand.  Because, let's face it, as much as I'm sure we'd all love to 
see these marriages stand, the chances that they won't be overturned 
are very VERY slim.

If someone does the right thing, but for entirely the wrong reason... 
does he deserve our admiration?  I'd say: "no".


cya,
john


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

partner benefits???  Every company *I*'ve worked for, so far as I can 
recall. does (or did, when they existed, anyway).  Hell, even IBM, the 
canonical "stodgy old conservative dinosaur" of companies, offers 
partner benefits.  (Though I must admit, I was suprised as hell when I 
found this out.  Turns out, not only does Big Blue offer partner 
benefits, they had a big booth at Pride a couple of years ago! (That's 
actually how I found out that IBM had gotten with the times.)).  Even 
the low-pay customer service job I'm working at, to make ends meet, NOW 
offers partner benefits!


cya,
john

Whoops- pre-emptive send there-

> Marriage as a whole should be
> supported, to whoever it is, as long as it's between
> people who love eachother. Thats what our kids
> should learn, and thats whats important.

That's a pretty large thing to say- where do you draw
the line?
When "gay marriage" was being discussed several months
ago (some other state- dont remember)- there was what
I saw as a very hypocritical response from certain
gay-community leaders- that being "disgust" at the
comparison of gay marriage to polygamous marriage.

They are both "non-traditional" unions that from a
common-sense point of view seem to harm nobody
whatsoever.

"Marriage" should be *solely* a religious act, and
have no bearing upon taxes, inheritance, familial
rights, or anything else.  Legitimizing "gay marriage"
just furthers the legitimization of "marriage", and
reflects IMO a rather short-sighted view.

One of my professors had an interesting insight on this.

He thought it was very telling that people had bought into the institution
of marriage so readily, that they were /happy/ that they could do it. He
was mystified. Put it on par with women wanting to be police officers and
serving in the armed service. "Those are probably the two crappiest jobs
you can have. A cop and a soldier. Why would you WANT that job?"

> I dunno.... I can't help bt be of two minds on this one....
>
>
> On the one hand:
>
> I do agree that marriage is a fundamental right that should not be
> denied to any human; and especially not based on their sexual
> orientation.  I'm not particularly ready to GET married, myself.  And
> when I find out how young some people ARE getting married, I'm like...
> "WTF...  you're still so young...  you have your whole lives ahead of
> you and you're settling down and going domestic NOW????"  Hell, I'm
> closer to 30 than 20, and I still think *I* am too young to be married!
>   But WTF.... I still think it should be EVERYONE's right to have that
> choice.
>
> As a bonus, pretty much anything that pisses off the xtians, the
> republicans, and their ilk, gets two hearty thumbs up from me.  And
> this sure has a lot of them riled up.
>
>
> But on the other hand:
>
> It is perfectly obvious to me that this is nothing more than a public
> relations ploy by "da mayor", as part of an effort to fool the gullible
> into beliving that he is not the right-wing ogre that he is.  He may
> masquerade as a liberal by claiming to be a democrat.  But he's
> certianly *NOT* left-of-center.  To see the REAL progressives in the
> mayors race, look to those who ran againse newson.  Look to Tom Ammiano
> and Matt Gonzalez.
>
> Basiclly, we have willie brown Mk. 2...  another mayor who pretends to
> be liberal in order to get votes, but is really well to the right of
> the opposition.  The only difference seems to be that while brown was
> open in his corruption and pandering to the conservative intrests in
> SF, and indeed, he seemed to revel in it; gavin newsom is aparantly
> employing some PR people, and throwing the city's progressives a bone.
>
> And make no mistake.  This is just a zero-risk publicity stunt on the
> part of newsom.  He KNOWS how close he came to losing the election to a
> REAL liberal.  He KNOWS that the progressives smell the blood in the
> water, and will be going for his throat; and might just cut it, in the
> next election.  This gay-marriage stunt is an easy way for him to
> appear to be the liberal choice, without having to actually take a
> stand.  Because, let's face it, as much as I'm sure we'd all love to
> see these marriages stand, the chances that they won't be overturned
> are very VERY slim.
>
> If someone does the right thing, but for entirely the wrong reason...
> does he deserve our admiration?  I'd say: "no".
>

(or so he says).

love eachother. Thats what our kids should learn, and thats whats important.

to vote against the gay marriage rights of couples. And I think the whole 
voting deal was somewhat biased since some of the only places around here offering 
voting thingies (whatever the hell theyre called) were in churches.  Every

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: JJ Islas on An Epiphany of Sound

We've got a local house head dropping by and he's already dropping some
REALLY tasty  selections.  The "he" I refer to is JJ Islas.  He's
bringing us a true San Francisco style house set today, leading up until
11a (but really something you might normally have expected to hear
at around 3-4a in an old dirty warehouse back in the day.)  So do listen
in between now and 11a.

The usual bat channel: 90.1 FM, or online at
http://kzsulive.stanford.edu

Peace!

-- 
As a wise old buddha said:
"Before enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water.
After enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water."

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

=20
This Friday the 20th  of February at Mezzanine.

Scott Carrelli, Satellite Productions and Platform Sound have put
together some of San Francisco top DJs (the Iron Chefs if you will),
each with their own distinctive sound. Thats 8 greats in total costing
you only 99 cents at the door!=20

DRAGNFLY - IRON CHEF PSY-TRANCE
FOREST GREEN - IRON CHEF TECHNO
ALEX WHALEN - IRON CHEF PROGRESSIVE HOUSE
FELIX THE DOG - IRON CHEF BREAKS
SCOTT CARRELLI - IRON CHEF HOUSE TRANCE
FRED FUNK - IRON CHEF FUNKY HOUSE
DJ SPLICE - IRON CHEF DEEP HOUSE

9pm to 4am at Mezzanine 444 Jessie at Mint.
No you are not dreaming this team is only 99=A2.
Check it.=20

Flyer:  http://www.djdragnfly.com/past/Feb20-2004-2/index.htm

Special thanks to Mark and MV Galleries for the pics! =20

=20

**Disclaimer** - this party is being put on by people with a sense of
humour, so if you find yourself offended by it, well - poop on you!=20

 <http://www.djdragnfly.com>=20

Date: Thu, 19 Feb 2004 09:49:37 -0800 (PST)
From: georgeC <newstylesound@yahoo.com>

In-Reply-To: <20040219070950.28630.qmail@web13907.mail.yahoo.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] GO GO Gavin, gay marriages

--- Nathan Seven <scosol@yahoo.com> wrote:
> "Marriage" should be *solely* a religious act, and
> have no bearing upon taxes, inheritance, familial
> rights, or anything else.  Legitimizing "gay marriage"
> just furthers the legitimization of "marriage", and
> reflects IMO a rather short-sighted view.

I agree with this, however, I don't think that the gay community is
asking for a federally-sanctioned way into a religious institution.  I
think the main reason it's being thought of as the "gay marriage issue"
is that the term "marriage" has no religious charge for most people
anymore.  To most, it represents solely the legal and personal joining
of a couple.  

If I were gay and somebody told me, "It's wrong for you to get married,
but maybe I can deal with you obtaining a civil union", I think I'd
feel a bit disenfranchised that my love was seen as something only
bindable by a clinical-sounding legal contract.  The larger issue,
though, seems to be, where is the separation of church and state on
this?  This is like the gov't selling prayer licenses.

If a heterosexual atheist couple want to get hitched, what right have
they to "marriage" if it's an intrinsically religious ceremony?  What
about a satanist couple?

Just stirring up trouble,
George

RAD. Now what's funny is I know of people that have bought them not for =
the player, but the Hitachi 4GB Microdrive inside. See if you have a =
dSLR camera you need lots of storage. Retail on that microdrive is $499, =
but buy an iPod Mini or a Creative MuVo for $250 or $299 respectively =
and you get the drive for a serious discount. And yeah... just hack the =
gear open and take out the drive which is no different than a retail =
microdrive! Still the same Type II CF format.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] GO GO Gavin, gay marriages

thinking about it, yeah

marriage SHOULD be mainly a religious joining of people who love eachother.
It shouldn't be controlled by laws, or courts, or whatever.
But it's not like that. Judges marry people. It's like signing a contract
nowadays, you have to pay money to get married, pay lots more if you want to
have a divorce granted to you. You should be able to start and stop it when
you want to for whatever reason you choose to. I don't think it should have
bearing on peoples incomes, or bank accounts, or things like loans,
mortgages, etc, but it does. At least so called traditional marriages do.

I don't like either direction of traditional marriages. I'm not christian,
I'm wiccan. And I wouldn't want to go to a judge and get married cuz I don't
think it's the states decision for such a thing. But as far as I know,
wiccan marriages aren't legally accepted in CA. For me marriage would just
be like a blood promise to someone I loved that I would be there for them
forever if not longer. It should just be a ceremony significant to the
couple being joined, but thats not how it is anymore.

With all the legalities involved, it's weird to see the country sticking to
the whole man/woman thing. It's kind of a religious act, but the counrty
treats it all like a business merger or something.

either way, if it was religious based, then it should be between people who
love eachother no matter who they are. If it's legally based, then why is
there such a stress off it being wrong for two men or two women to get
married when it's pretty much just a legally binding "on paper" type of
agreement, thats all contracted out n such.

Someone told me the other day that Dennis Rodman married himself ? is that
true ? Mormons traditionally could have several wives legally, and in some
states that's recognized as legit, not A man and A woman like mr bushie
says.

Anyone watch divorce court on tv ? Thats just a big huge shiny example of
some of the things most fukked up about marriage these days in all sorts of
ways.

the whole issue just contradicts itself back and forth in lots of ways. Shit
you have to get a license to get married even. I'm suprised that people
aren't arrested for having sex without a license.

when and if I get married, it'll be me n my partners ceremony. I'll give
them half of my everything in life and they'll do that for me, but not cuz a
court tells us to, but cuz we want to. Of course that probably won't be
"legal" but thats not the point. I'd hate to have to hire a lawyer to write
up pre-nuptual contracts n such, and another to enforce them if we happened
to split up.

the whole gay marriage thing, I suppose most of these people just really
wanted a nationally recognized joining rather than a between them thing.
They just want the same rights as most everyone else in this country, and by
them being gay, the country is basically saying it's illegal for them to
ever get married.

I wonder if someday you'll be able to get married over the internet. . .

aK

Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_5339387==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] GO GO Gavin, gay marriages

--=====================_5339387==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

--- Nathan Seven <scosol@yahoo.com> wrote:

 > "Marriage" should be *solely* a religious act, and
 > have no bearing upon taxes, inheritance, familial
 > rights, or anything else.  Legitimizing "gay marriage"
 > just furthers the legitimization of "marriage", and
 > reflects IMO a rather short-sighted view.

I agree, and the state has no business establishing religious dogma via a 
constitutional amendment or other means to force others who are not 
Christians or others who have beliefs in the "sanctity" of marriage to 
accept those beliefs by force of law.  Funny, isn't it, that one of the 
Christian denominations was founded by a King (Henry VIII) who wanted to 
divorce at will to meet his needs? He just changed the rules and started 
his own church, the Church of England.

This is a complex issue, however, with a philosophical, romantic, legal and 
political dimensions.

The mass marriages at City Hall are, to my mind, a powerful symbolic 
gesture.  My home town, Pittsburgh, is a pretty conservative place but this 
morning the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette ran this on the editorial page:  "...As 
symbolism it has struck a deep chord, dramatically illustrating the hunger 
of gay couples for official recognition, something that any compassionate 
society would attempt to accommodate..."  So far I understand 2,400+ 
couples have stood in long lines and paid fees to demonstrate that 
need.   One would like to have one's relationship honored and respected by 
the commonweal.

But there are political dimensions here also.  I agree with John B that 
Gavin was motivated more by political than philosophical beliefs in taking 
this action.  That's life in the political world.  Conservatives will use 
this move to fuel a backlash against gays and move to take legal actions on 
the Federal level.

Even the gay community, however, is not united in support of the 
institution of marriage.  They believe it's an outmoded institution;  puts 
folks into an emotional and sexual box;  and turns love into a business 
transaction, or worse, mutual hatred.  Then there is the issue of 
monogamy.  Traditional "marriage" supports fidelity.  I think, 
however,  couples define the parameters of their relationships, not the 
state, regarding monogamy and other crucial areas of the relationship. 
Emotional fidelity -- love if you will -- is far more important to 
longevity than physical fidelity.  Passion often overrules reason, 
especially in subcultures where folks are ambivalent at best about sexual 
fidelity.  I've found that compassion and complete honesty are crucial to 
the success of long-term relationships and these virtues, again, arise from 
love.

The legal implications of the City Hall marriages are, at best, 
ambiguous.  Those who now have Domestic Partner benefits may lose them on 
both the state and local level.  Looks like the state will not recognize 
these marriage licenses when they arrive in Sacramento.

I have a personal interest in all this, I must add.  This year my partner 
Joey and I will have been together 25 years.  We were in the first group to 
be registered as Domestic Partners in San Francisco a few years ago and 
were "married" by the mayor and a group of supervisors at a ceremony in the 
Opera House.  Couples were called up to the stage, and we all exchanged 
promises in front of this vast group of well-wishers and press.

Marriage, civil unions, or whatever one wants to call them, provide the 
needed legal and other structures necessary for responsible relationships 
and basic rights.  Back when lots of gay men were dying every day with AIDS 
their partners were often treated with contempt by blood relatives and 
others; prevented from visiting the partner in the hospital;  or even 
attending the funeral. Many were tossed out into the streets without the 
monies and property both partners had worked hard for.  Sure, one can write 
wills and powers of attorney.  There are many firms with domestic partner 
benefits.  But entering a long-term relationship, if your seriously 
committed, requires some structure for both partners.  I've also seen cases 
where two people have lived and built a life involving property 
accumulation, and one day a partner decides to throw the other out with 
nothing.

Since this December marks our 25th anniversary, Joey and I will wait until 
then to "marry" if this option is still available in San Francisco.  If 
not, we will have another commitment ceremony.  But until these marriages 
are recognized by the State of California and the Federal government I 
doubt there will be many benefits and the ceremony, again, will be largely 
symbolic.  Long ago Joey and I created legal constructs that assure 
property and other safeguards, like will and Powers of Attorney to cover 
illness and death.

Love,

Apollo



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                 http://mokshatribe.org/photos/

safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

merger of state and corporate power."
-Benito Mussolini

rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr: Fraudulent Earthink Emails asking for CC info

There are tons of scams like this, purporing to be from Paypal and
Citibank and whatnot. You should never enter any personal information in
response to a link in any email. Emails are incredibly easy to forge, and
legitimate financial institutions will never communicate about private
information over email with you.

> There are tons of scams like this, purporing to be from Paypal and
> Citibank and whatnot. You should never enter any personal information in
> response to a link in any email. Emails are incredibly easy to forge, and
> legitimate financial institutions will never communicate about private
> information over email with you.
>
>

In-Reply-To: <004301c3f77a$66b49f90$43fea8c0@sziggo>
Message-ID: <Pine.LNX.4.33.0402192252400.31218-100000@charm>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr: Fraudulent Earthink Emails asking for CC info

That link just goes to Earthlink's the main page. This address is probably
what the email page is displaying to you, while the real link address
(where you go when you click on the link) points to some server in Russia
or somesuch. There are several ways to do this. One of the most commonly
used methods was removed in the latest Internet Explorer security patch.


On Thu, 19 Feb 2004, aK wrote:

> it actually looked legit,
>
> here was the link:  http://www.earthlink.net/?action=billing.htm
>
> Earthlink.net is the actual earthlink site, following the link everything
> looks legit also.

Sup people

Just wanted to let people on SFR know that the latest dnb mix by Tha Megatron 
is out and for sale at Amoeba Music in San Francisco and Skills DJ Workshop 
in Berkeley. The original Drum n Bass mix series GhettoTek Rollaz is in its 3rd 
volume entitled "ExtraMental Beatz". Here's a tracklisting. Check it out:

1. Intro/DJ Die "100 Miles and Runnin'"
2. DJ Hype "Mash Up Da Place" (DJ Hazard Remix)
3. Lil Louis "French Kiss" (Ed Rush & Optical Remix)
4. Calibre "It's Over"
5. Jonny L "Let's Roll"
6. Origin Unknown f/ Dynamite MC "Hotness" (Roni Size VIP Mix)
7. Adam F "Original Jungle Sound" (Bluenote Mix)
8. You Don't Know Who Did This "You Don't Need To Know"
9. Total Science "Nosher" (Baron Remix)
10. The Militia "Weight Gain"
11. Total Science "Champion Sound" (Generation Dub Remix)
12. I Kamanchi "Movin' Fast"
13. Klute "Take A Breath"
14. Bassment Jaxx f/ Dizzie Rascal "Lucky Star" (Dillinja Dub Remix)
15. Gridlok "Heatwave"
16. Dillinja "Time Out"
17. Total Science "Whitehouse"
18. Special Forces "Dirty"
19. Future Sound Of London "Papua New Guinea" (High Contrast Remix)
20. Doc Scott "NHS" (Total Science Remix)
21. Hive "Neo" (Agent Smith Takeover Mix)
22. Bad Company f/ Rawhill Kru "Mo' Fire"

and u can preview it here:
http://www.digitalbombing.com/audio/mp3/a1/megatron.m3u
also for the garage crew check out "Urban Swing 2002", the original UK Garage 
mix series being sold at Amoeba in SF and Skills in Berkeley.

have a nice day

thaMEGATRON

Team all week, come and take it out on the Wanna B
Team, wontcha???

SCOTT CARRELLI

Subject: [sfraves] Demand change from the music industry's copyright cartel

--=====================_23964619==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Historic Online Protest

It's time for music fans to stand up and demand change from the music 
industry's copyright cartel.

Tuesday, February 24 will be a day of coordinated civil disobedience: 
websites will post Danger Mouse's Grey Album on their site for 24 hours in 
protest of EMI's attempts to censor this work.

http://www.greytuesday.org/





Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                 http://mokshatribe.org/photos/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans and the homeless, 
whether the mad destruction is wrought under the name of totalitarianism or 
the holy name of liberty or democracy?"
-Mahatma Gandhi

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"  
--=====================_23964619==.ALT--

Saturday, February 21, 2004 ** ***Mirage*** presented by Illumination Recor=
ds, Hardscience, and friends **

As many of you may know already, Mirage first appeared as a Wednesday club =
night here in San Jose. Unfortunately, as with many nightclubs in the scene=
, the venue was sold and new owners came in to change the club into a blues=
-rock bar. Mirage with its family and friends enjoyed a fun 2003 run and th=
e night vanished just before winter. Recently, we were told that Mirage wil=
l once again take shape in February. All who were involved with Mirage will=
 return to help recreate the magic and build a safe-haven for its reappeara=
nce. As the prophets give us more information, we will forward the details =
to you. Returning to the source of power are Mirage resident DJs: Michael L=
iu (Illumination Records), Denise (Sound Asylum), Dragn'fly (Shaolin), Maje=
re (Elektrosorcery), and Proteus (Vibe Rite). Crisp clean concert sound pow=
ered by Logik Pro. Much more information to follow on this all ages event..=
=2E If you wish to help direct your positive energies to the rematerializat=
ion of Mirage, please get in touch.
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1069
TBA California, USA

secured a new night, at the same location.

napalm that you've come to enjoy, being dropped without hesitation. We are =
putting out a call for the masses to join our party, a temporal community w=

Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

>name to

>are

>disclose
