I used to wear suits a lot and I have these clean Windridge (i think)
bergundy wingtips. I loved these shoes, I went thru a couple sets, they're
pretty sick for that type of shoe, I'l polish em and they just looked clean
and were super comfortable if you had to wear them all day, every day. I
don't remember how much they cost, but it was more than I ever paid for
shoes. . .

now I have the reg addidias (diff colors), like the superstars but without
the rubber toe. . . usually wear skate shoes, like DC's or something like
that.

I always liked the look when someone was wearing a dark suit, with a long
coat, braces/tie, and their shoes were a standout color, like bergundy, or
green or something. . . I dug wearing suits cuz most people just don't know
how to dress, well guys in suits. . .there is such a thing as accessories
for men, and short sleeve dress shirts are just wack. . .It's like, if you
know what i mean, most people tend to look like "salespeople/management" or
"technicians".

buuuuuuuuuut yep. . .

I used to have those patent leather burgundy airwalks a while back. . .

: )

aK

hello this is a continuation of a fictional work...also, sorry that we could not make our column date yesterday...we were trying to figure out why...there were two unexpected things that came up..actually, three now that we think of it...understaffed, illness, and sudden interesting person taking up a slot of time and moving everything backwards and forwards..so, for anyone with any sort of sensitivities, we apologize....
 
the kids want candies, clothes and happiness. they want education too. oscar and his wife need help getting these things. they also want all of the same things for themselves. so far, all they are doing is bothering the wrong people. actually, bothering is  a very light word for describing the reality of the situation, which makes them pretty average on the world hate scale. :)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [SRR] ecstasy study ok'ed

-------------------------------1077838796
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I don't see anything about a change from Schedule I. It appears to be an 
exception, as it's been in the works for a couple of years. Perhaps if this study 
goes well, there will be a chance for it to lose the Schedule I status. That 
status was never appropriate, anyway, because MDMA had been shown to have 
clinical value and was only changed to Schedule I because people were enjoying it 
recreationally. 

The American way of thinking about pharmaceuticals says it's ok to have drugs 
that take away pain, but drugs that induce happiness are strictly verboten -- 
even when they have a unique therapeutic use. 

-------------------------------1077838796--

From: "John B." <SvnLyrBrto@yahoo.com>

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Enough is bein SAID...What are we goin to DO?


> With regard to the "back room deals" and general corruption, I defy you
> to give an example of a similar-sized economy that has significantly
> less.  Sure, ideally, such corruption would be rooted out and stopped.
> But the cynical part of me believes that, humans being humans, power
> corrupts; and a certian amount of corruption is inevitable.
>
> I do, however, firmly believe that the more distant the government, the
> worse the government; and that local government will always respond
> better to the needs and wants of the people than some far-off overlord.
>
> But as far as the taxation issue goes, you're dead wrong.  You'd do
> well to check out this page:
>
> http://www.bcnys.org/whatsnew/2001/1211balance.htm
>
> Californians pay over 63 BILLION dollars more in federal taxes, per
> year, than the state gets back in federal money!  That's "billion" with
> the big "B"!!!  Sixty-three of them!
>
> Fiscally, California could easily do without the rest of the US.  In
> fact, we'd be far better off without them.  If California were to
> secede from the US... If that money were kept in California, instead of
> being leached off to feed a bunch of the more parasitic of the states,
> California could easily:
>
> 1) Make up for the federal money we'd lose (much LESS than we pay to
> DC, remember)
> 2) Balance our state budget
> 3) Boost a lot of our social services
> 4) And STILL have enough left to give Californians a big honkin'
> (overall) tax break!
>
> Sure, some of that money would still be lost to corruption and your
> "back room deals".  But it would be lost in Sacramento instead of
> washington.  And it's much easier to notice corruption when it''s an
> hour's drive up the 80 than when it's three-thousand miles away.  It's
> much easier to find out about it, and with California's more direct
> democracy (via the proposition and recall systems) it's much easier to
> root it out, as Grey Davis found out just a few months ago.  (Imagine
> just how short the bush/ashcroft regime would have been, if the ability
> to recall the chief executive (and various hangers-on) existed, at the
> national level, as it does here.)
>
> When you come right down to it, Scott is 100% correct.  Regardless of
> some of the shady things that go on in California; they pale in
> comparison to the rest of the blighted country.  And we'd be far better
> off without the rest of the US dragging us down, slowing us down, and
> suckling at the teat of our tax dollars; all the while hating us for
> socially progressing farther ahead than them.
>
>

never posted bout it.  Well, here they are, in all their downloadable
glory.  Urrything here is available on the site as well.  Plus there's a
couple extras as well:)

Subject: [sfraves] NOOKIE tonight @ SOMA Sessions

SOMA Sessions
Drum 'n Bass Fourth Fridays @ AsiaSF
http://www.somasessions.com

TONIGHT - February 27, 2004

As featured in the SF Weekly's Beatbox column, this
month SOMA Sessions is proud to welcome...

NOOKIE (Good Looking Records - UK)

With countless releases on Reinforced, Moving Shadow
and LTJ Bukem's Good Looking, Nookie's style and
artistic vision have pushed the boundaries of Drum &
Bass leaving countless classics in his wake.  His
highly sought-after talents as a producer, engineer,
remixer and DJ have taken him around the world many
times.  SOMA Sessions is excited and honored to host
this seminal artist for an evening of amazing music.

ULTRAVIOLET (Sleeveless, SF Agency)

UltraViolet is known to level dance floors with her
wide range of styles and fierce skills. This founding
member of the notorious Sleeveless collective is not
to be missed!

Resident Support:

DJ M (SOMA Sessions, Faultline, Freebeats)

SOUND:BOY (SOMA Sessions, Hemisphere, Brass Tax)


** Discount presale tickets have sold out but there
will be $15 tickets available at the door! **

Hours: 10:30pm - 3am
Entry: 21+ with photo ID
Tickets: $10 presale, $15 door
Drink specials: $3 Lemon Drop shots all night!

To sign up on our mailing list or for more info, visit
http://somasessions.com

AsiaSF
201 Ninth Street at Howard St
San Francisco, California 94103

AsiaSF serves 3-Star Cal-Asian cuisine in a festive
and stylish atmosphere.  For Sunday through Thursday
dinner reservations, please call 415.255.ASIA(2742)
from 1pm to 8pm or visit http://www.asiasf.com.

SOMA branding & print design by Ryan @ Citizen-7
http://www.citizen-7.com/


NEXT MONTH - Friday March 26, 2004
_ ASC (Covert Operations - UK)
_ Illformants (Breakbeat Science, Subtitles)

	With the exception of alcohol, the government establishment defines 
using a drug for the purposes of enjoyment or recreation as "abuse." So 
"how happy it makes you" in fact does become the basis for prohibition. 
"Scheduling" is a bureaucratic bullshit word in this context. Trains 
are "scheduled"; drugs are "prohibited" or "banned."

				<<< Starchild >>>

http://www.resourcerecords.com/audio/mixes/dj_darwyn_10_24_93.mp3

this is a live dj mix i did back in '93 at an after
party.  maaaaaan...it was sooo wierd how i got ahold
of this thing again..looong story.  looking back, i
don't think i have a copy of ANY of my early tapes. 
nor do i have a label copy of many of my first vinyl
releases...doh!  guess i should have saved a couple! 
enjoy the flashback!

chris jackson

	Just to be clear, I wasn't criticizing anyone for using the word  
"scheduling," just objecting to the word itself. I think the government  
uses words like this because it spreads a thick layer of bureaucratese  
over the ugly, naked reality that they are in the business of telling  
other people, ultimately at gunpoint, how to live their lives.

					<<< Starchild >>>


On Friday, February 27, 2004, at 03:50  PM, Starchild wrote:

> 	With the exception of alcohol, the government establishment defines  
> using a drug for the purposes of enjoyment or recreation as "abuse."  
> So "how happy it makes you" in fact does become the basis for  
> prohibition. "Scheduling" is a bureaucratic bullshit word in this  
> context. Trains are "scheduled"; drugs are "prohibited" or "banned."
>
> 				<<< Starchild >>>

Friday, February 27, 2004 ** Progression's New Night! With Guest's fLOORCRA=
fT & Marc(0) **

 pro=B7gres=B7sion n.
The process of progressing; progress.
Movement from one member of a continuous series to the next.
A continuous series; a sequence.
Mad LOVE to all those who made our Sunday's a success. As intended we have =
secured a new night, at the same location.

Our new monthly event will fall on the 4th Friday's of each month.

Same great resident's, all new guest dj's, and that consistent progressive =
napalm that you've come to enjoy, being dropped without hesitation. We are =
putting out a call for the masses to join our party, a temporal community w=
here an attitude of acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the=
 next chapter in our underground movement, with its roots founded on electr=
onic music and our personal desire to expose it to everyone.

Saturday, February 28, 2004 ** Preserve 1 Year Anniversary presented by Pre=
serve **

I know, it only seems like yesterday that we had our first event; Eridanus.=
 But Preserve is turning ONE YEAR'S OLD in February. Join us as we celebrat=
e one hell of a year!!!

It all started with Eridanus. A celebration of Unity and the coming of a ne=
w. We all peered up into the stars, at one star, at OUR STAR...Unity!!!

Next we celebrate Preserve the Beach. Dancing under the stars under a gorge=
ous setting. Directly on the beach we danced the night away within a green =
lit cove. Preserve the Beach and celebrate that.

Remembrance was soon to follow. We gathered to honor the vibe of days past.=
 To remember what it was like to get to know your fellow ravers. Tons of ga=
mes to play, tons of prizes to win, and tons of fun was had. Celebrate

And none of us can forget RENEGADE!!! Join us as we celebrate the feeling o=
f enjoying life in such a sacred space as Home Base. Quote of the night..."=
The cops are parked outside our door, waiting for us to come out. So the on=
ly option I see that we have is to turn the music back on and party like ro=
ckstars." Celebrate the fact that we are ravers; it's something to be proud=
 of!!!

We've said time after time, "This is not a night to miss." Every event we'v=
e ever designed have been quality. We want everyone to make it out to this =
one. And to help make this possible we are making the opening tickets only =
$5 Then $10 and lastly $15. We will definately be letting our hair down and=
 enjoying our turning one years old!!!

Friday, March 12, 2004 ** Booty, Breaks and Balaclavas **

BOOTY, BREAKS AND BALACLAVAS

Outdoor DJ area at the Anarchist Cafe

featuring DJs Tomkat, Morse Code and J. Clang
booty, breaks, techno, plus

This is part of the Anarchist Cafe, a benefit for the Anarchist Bookfair an=
d anarchist political prisoner Sherman Austin

There will be a vegan dinner and performers inside, video, DJs and dancing =
outside.


$5 - $15 donation requested
No one turned away for lack of funds

dinner 6:30
performers indoors 7-10
video 8-9
dancing 9 ^=D1til midnight

all ages!  kid friendly!

drug and alcohol free space.
wheelchair accessible.


The Bay Area Anarchist Bookfair, now in its ninth year, takes places on Sat=
urday, March 13 from 10am to 6pm at the S.F. County Fair Building on 9th Av=
enue in Golden Gate Park.  Admission is free, and speakers include Starhawk=
, Alexander Cockburn, Jeffrey St. Clair, Lynn Breedlove, Tim^=D2M T. West, =
Katya Komisaruk, Agent Apple of the Biotic Baking Brigade, Susan Greene, Su=
n Frog and Sean Sullivan.  For more information call (415) 431-8355.

Sherman Austin, a 20 year-old, black, Southern California anarchist, was th=
e webmaster of the site www.raisethefist.com. He is the first person to be =
charged under 18 U.S.C. 842(p), a 1997 "anti-terrorism" law authored by Cal=
ifornia Senator Dianne Feinstein.  What was Austin^=D2s crime?  He had had =
offered free hosting and a link on his website to a site he did not author =
called The Reclaim Guide, offering general security culture information alo=
ng with a small portion dealing with explosives.  This information is publi=
cly available, yet Austin has been jailed for merely linking to it.

On August 4, Sherman Austin was sentened to one year in federal prison and =
three years probation.  His probation includes the following terms: Austin =
cannot possess or access a computer of any kind without prior approval of h=
is probation officer; if he gets that approval, the equipment is subject to=
 monitoring and to search and seizure at any time, without notice; he must =
surrender his phone, DSL, electric, and satellite bills to his probation of=
ficer; and he cannot associate with any person or group--environmental, soc=
ial justice, political, or economic--that seeks to change the government in=
 any way.

Although Austin initially planned to fight the charge and go to trial, he a=
ccepted a plea bargain after being threatened with serving up to 20 years i=
n jail. Despite both the FBI and the Justice Department agreeing on a sente=
nce of four months in jail and four months in community confinement, the ju=
dge increased the sentence to set an example for future "revolutionaries."


For more information about Sherman Austin, please see:

www.freesherman.org
http://www.counterpunch.org/merlin08162003.html
http://rwor.org/a/1217/austin.htm
http://www.infoshop.org/shermanaustin.html

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1147

// From Europe to the U.S., Simply Jeff^=D2s name is known for the love of =
Breakbeat music. As a dj, Jeff plays an eclectic blend of Breaks which inco=
rporate the many sub genres of Electronic music. From Funky Breaks to House=
y Breaks, from Old School to Nu Skool, Simply Jeff dedicates the "Breakbeat=
 sound" to the public every week while performing in clubs to massive event=
s that reach to 40,000 in attendance. Many of the records that he plays at =
these events can be found on his various mix cd compilations. "Funk-Da-Frie=
d 1& 2 on City Of Angels and "Funky Intrumentalist" on Brooklyn Music Limit=
ed with more on the way! You may also find him djing on the World Wide Web =
as a monthly resident on Grooveradio.com as well as having his own 24 hour =
streaming Breakbeat show on radio.yahoo.com under Electronica. Simply Jeff =
also writes music reviews for the Breakbeat section in the Los Angeles base=
d magazine called "BPM Culture".

Administrative Notes

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [SRR] ecstasy study ok'ed

No.  Scheduling has to do with whether or not the big capitalists who
influence our government can make a profit off the drug.  Look at caffeine,
alcohol and tobacco if you don't believe me -- three of the most widely
"abused" drugs out there and they're still legal.  Not to mention
ritalin/aderall or vicodin/oxycontin...those pharmaceutical companies just
make too much money off those drugs.

*emma*

Subject: [sfraves] Thursday night adventure.... WOw

OK... so i almost finished all the work in the management class that actually just ended Thursday night... I did take the final 4 that class & got an A+... YAY!  NOw I have 2 focus on finishing my papers 'cause the teacher was mondo kinda enough to give me a week extension to & give me a letter grade...

Sorry... just had 2 vent that... LoL

So being that class ended early... I didn't know what to do... I woulda just went over to Anu & hang out w/ the Happy Hour DJs who are starting 2 like become really good friend now... but then I remembered... :code... so i got dropped off on 11th & as soon as i walked up to the front of the club... YAAAAAAAAAY... there was Shane!!!!  It was So Groovy finally seein' him again & talkin' 2 him!  Well.. the :code wasn't quite like open open yet... 

so I went 2 Butter 4 a bit... WOW... see. 'cause what's funny is that like 2-3 months ago... I heard some well, gossip about Butter & lastnight I found out that alota the rumors I heard were true & well... there's a new owner there now, Matt,  & Carlton, the old owner, moved to a really small island in the South... kinda sad 'cause he never emailed me & told me this was goin' on & gosh... la la la...

Then I went over 2 Studio Z for a bit... I"m friend w/ some of the bouncers there... Wow... I got some scoop about that venue also from Security.. yeah... trippy...

AnywaZe, went back 2 DNA & they were like open so I went inside.  They were like still setting up stuff in the front room & DJ Meliss was geting ready upstairs... LoL.. it was Groovy 'cause like I saw Dusty Brown on stage & walked up to him to say like HI & stuff... then it was weird... he remembered me from the last time we met & Wow... we had like an Awesome conversation & he took a pix of us on his dig cam... oh WOw... LoL... Gosh man... I didn't realize how much I missed 11 street...

Well... I dunno... I was like totally fiending 4 some Hard-Grooves on the speakers, so well... I figured might as well just go 2 Anu... so I talked a lil' bit more 2 Dusty Brown & well.. I wanted to try to time it so I could go back 2 :code 4 his Live PA set when I got my fill of Bad Kitty...

So treked over 2 Anu & LoL... it was fun!!  The music during happy hour is so elclectic that it totally trips U out, ya know?  So yeah... those spun spun everything from gangster rap, to pop, to house, to new wave.  

Then Sarah Lushess went on the decks.. busted out w/ some 80's as usual... Love it... then well... she was spinning like some Eletro Clash (I think), then eventually ended her set playing Ghetto Tek!  Oh Gosh man.. I Loved it!!!

OK... then the Chicago Import DJ who spun next, DJ SubK, ooh my goodness man.. she spun this totally fuckin' Awesome set!!!  I mean... she went in & out of her set w/ Electro, Old School Hip Hop (Hello 2Day, she played fuckin' "Sally" by Gucci Crew), & man... it was jus' fuckin' Sick!  She totally like brought in this Awesome Energy w/ her set.. seriously... Good shit man...

Closing the night out was Ghetto Tek Super Hero Baby Daddy!!!  LoL... Oh man... he opened w/ the ummmmm... ok.. g rated mentin of the song he opened w/... bootie & boobies... LoL... & well.. he kept up this mondo edgey energy like manly throught out the whole set... then like it well.. mellowed out a lil' like almost towards the end... BUt Fuckin' A man...  I was Lovin' this set!!!  Oh My Goodness man... I know a trick now that Baby Daddy does.. he talks old 80's rap songs & plays them during his sets like totally sped up 2 match the GT beats he's thrown down already!!  LoL...I recall 2 songs from that night... Brass Monkey insrt & the other song was like the used in Breakin' 2 I think at the end during the show as the song for the main performance... Doo Dah Dumb doo Dah Dumb.. ya knw what I"m talkin' about... that song?

BUt man... the music @ Bad Kitty was fuckin' Bad Ass!  Oh oh oh... so yeah.. Live 105 was there doin this promotion/ contest thingie there & 1 of the DJs from the station kept doing all that fancy talk in the middle of sets (grrrrrr.. hated that) oh yeah.. Erik Gilling won tickets to Squa Valley I think?  YAY... so yeah// there were hella people there like I guess 'til the hmmmmm... middle of the night I guess...

I met up w/ My Homie Maximil @ Anu & well... during the last 20 minutes of Baby Daddy's fuckin' Groovy set... we decided to go 2 :code & see what was left of the night... yeah... I was kinda dreading walking back there again... but it's all in the name of danincg & good beats!

LoL... we got there & like well.. Forest was utside drunk so we chatted e/ her 4 a while...  LoL... but yeah... :code was over by 2AM & that's what time we got there...  so like 1 of the bouncers let me in & I walkined around 4 a bit.. talk a lil' more 2 Dusty Brown & he said he wasn't happy w/ his performance that night... so he's glad I was Groovin' 2 Ghetto Tech instead... LoL

Yaaaaaay... I saw Audio Angel there... Oh Man.. Love her!  We talked 4 a while & when i realized Maximill was outside still... I went back out... & we went home...

I dunno man... it was suck a totally fun night!!!  So Dope!

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] nancy nrr

hello, this is a continuation of a fictional piece:
 
nancy sat quietly opening and closing each drawer on her new desk at her new job.  her boss had told her that she'd be able to meet the staff under some fun circumstances at an upcoming party they were putting together.  just the same, she still felt ill at ease.  there were several old pens on the desk in a coffee mug that read, "my mom went to south dakota and all i got was this stupid mug"... she lifted one and attempted to drag it across a piece of old computer paper.  the ink inside had dried a shade of olive green, and the paper snagged and tore beneath the jagged pull of the tiny ball at the tip of the pen.  she'd never go back again, she thought to herself. no matter what, she'd never return. :)

Subject: [sfraves] Rec and Park meeting Wednesday, March 3, 2pm, City Hall Room 416

	A committee of the Recreation and Parks Commission will be discussing 
some items of interest to the electronic dance community this coming 
week!

WHEN:  Wednesday, March 3, starting at 2pm

WHERE: City Hall Room 416

WHAT:	
1. "Discussion and possible action to approve 'Another Planet 
Entertainment's' request to produce a gated, free, ticketed musical 
event at the Polo Field in Golden Gate Park on Saturday, September 11, 
2004 and a request to modify the amplified sound policy and permit 
amplified sound between the hours of 12 noon to 6:00 p.m. and a request 
to sell beer and wine."

2. "Discussion and possible action to amend the Recreation and Park 
Department's amplified sound permit policy for Sharon Meadow in Golden 
Gate Park."

	Please forward this email to anyone you know who wants more freedom 
for entertainment in San Francisco, and encourage people to come out 
and speak or show their support for (1) granting the Polo Field permit 
as requested for at *least* those hours if not longer, and (2) writing 
as liberal a policy as possible to govern amplified sound permits in 
Sharon Meadow.

Peace, love & liberty,
						<<< Starchild >>>


EXTRA ACTION ITEM:  Call Mayor Gavin Newsom's office at (415) 554-5942 
and ask that he appoint Libertarians or others who believe in 
minimizing restrictions on entertainment and nightlife to the 
Recreation and Park Commission and other city boards and agencies 
affecting music, dance, and after-hours events.

RE:  KTVU Broadcast - "Mystery Disease"

Due to the Academy Awards broadcast on another network on Sunday =
evening, March 1, 2004, KTVU Channel 2 has moved the broadcast of the =
"Mystery Disease" news feature to MONDAY, March 1, 2004 at 10:00PM.

KTVU made the schedule change as they want to reach the widest audience =
possible in the greater San Francisco Bay Area.=20

the news feature.  We will notify you of the specific details once they =
are confirmed.

More information to come to you in the next few days.
